<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Recherche Innovation&amp;Développt \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    HOUSTON-LOUISIANA STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Etats-Unis \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Description du poste<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>Rejoignez notre filiale TotalEnergies E&amp;P Research &amp; Technologies à Houston !<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Au cours des dernières années, de nombreuses études (par exemple, IAE &lt; IPCC) ont montré la nécessité d'éliminer le dioxyde de carbone (technologies CDR) afin de ne pas dépasser l'augmentation de température de 1,5 °C. La quantité estimée de CO2 à éliminer varie en fonction de la source mais atteindra certainement l'échelle de la gigatonne. Afin d'atteindre son ambition d'atteindre le zéro net d'ici 2050, TotalEnergies a mis en place un ambitieux programme de R&amp;D CCUS. Parmi les différentes stratégies envisagées, plusieurs projets CDR axés sur le captage direct de l'air (DAC) ont été lancés et sont actuellement gérés au TEEPRT (Houston, TX, USA).<\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n    <p>Vous soutiendrez l'équipe sur différents projets couvrant le DAC et d'autres solutions d'émissions négatives (NES). L'un des objectifs est de tester et d'utiliser une estimation des coûts développéE par TotalEnergies et son partenaire pour appréhender le coût DAC rapporté dans la littérature. Une étude paramétrique sera réalisée afin d'identifier les postes de coûts dominants et les axes de R&amp;D à prioriser (tritification, procédés électrochimiques de régénération centralisée, ...). D'autres NES tels que Direct Ocean Capture (DOC) et Biomass Carbon Removal and Storage (BiCRS) seront évalués par le biais d'un dépistage technologique, de la compréhension des réglementations et des incitations actuelles et de l'étude du marché potentiel pour TotalEnergies.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Postulez #JT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Contexte et Environnement<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p>Le\u002Fla titulaire du poste percevra une indemnité VIE selon le barème Business France et le logement sera fourni par la filiale <b>EN COLOCATION<\u002Fb>.<br> <br> Veuillez vérifier les conditions d’éligibilité au VIE sur le site internet <b>mon-vie-via.businessfrance.fr.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n de données et validation de l'implantation<br> <br> <b>Langues<\u002Fb><b> :<\u002Fb><br> Anglais : niveau C1<br> Français : niveau C1<br> <br> <b>PERMIS DE CONDUIRE OBLIGATOIRE (1 véhicule de service If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger. <br> <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> <b>TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP)<\u002Fb> is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &amp; demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.<br> <br> <b>Our Culture:<\u002Fb><br> <br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation.<br> <br> Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success while ensuring safety in all our operations.<br> <br> We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n extrêmement difficiles. Le portefeuille de la société aux États-Unis est composé d'actifs OBO onshore et offshore avec des caractéristiques géologiques et des niveaux de maturité très variés.\n     <br> \n     <br> L’optimisation des développements et la maximisation de la production nécessitent une synthèse approfondie de toutes les informations disponibles et un travail d'équipe efficace de manière à identifier, quantifier et valoriser les opportunités futures. En tant que membre de notre équipe, vous vivrez également la mise en production des nouveaux développements. En collaboration avec l'opérateur, la compréhension du comportement des champs pétroliers sera calibrée en fonction des observations et la stratégie de développement ajustée en conséquence.\n     <br> géologiques;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> S'assurer de la bonne évaluation des volumes en place et des incertitudes associées:<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participer à la synthèse dynamique avec les ingénieurs données de subsurface;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participer à la réalisation des objectifs du puits.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <br> Ce poste est une excellente occasion de développer non of the daily responsibilities and functions, including, but not limited to:<\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Assist Front Office in the management, optimization and cost control activities associated with the assigned regional pipelines, gathering systems and\u002For processing assets with its own specificities;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Independently communicate with internal teams and external counterparties on the daily Natural Gas &amp; NGL portfolio activities as well as forward horizon assumptions;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Nominate and monitor operational activities on the assigned regional pipelines, gathering systems and processing assets. Relay issues or concerns and advise Front Office on potential impacts and alternative solutions;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Analyze and verify all operational reports to ensure accurate and timely information is obtained and distributed to all parties involved within the assigned regional pipelines, gathering systems and processing assets;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure physical transactions are recorded accurately within the organization’s proprietary risk management system;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist internal groups in the deal flow, physical settlement process and reconciliation activities;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support business development in the interpretation and implementation of agreements;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist Trading Systems and Information Technology teams with on-going proprietary software improvements, and<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Contribute to the development, implementation and continuous improvement of effective internal controls.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>Context and Environment<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Volatile U.S. energy markets<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Highly competitive environment for new business and growth opportunities due to new market entrants<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Highly skilled and mobile workforce<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Fast moving trading environment involving time critical activities and high\u002Frisk rewards from trading operations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The Company is responsible for the Company’s gas, power, dry bulk, and LNG trading and marketing activities in North America<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Excellent organizational and computer skills, with strong Excel skills required (for example strong Pivot Table, VLookup; If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger. <br> <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &amp; demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.<br> <br> Our Culture:<br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation.<br> <br> Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success while ensuring safety in all our operations.<br> <br> We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> TotalEnergies Trading &amp; Shipping (T&amp;S), an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies T&amp;S is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.<br> <br> Our Culture:<br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. Monitor and revise instrument repair procedures that are not “best in practice”.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide instrument engineering services, and or guidance for refinery capital, expense, and during turn-around activities projects to insure refinery standards are met (PARES).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identify and eliminate “bad actor” instrument installations to reduce cost and improve production.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and issue Management of Change documentation required to satisfy OSHA PSM 29-CFR-1910.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Investigate equipment failures and issue change recommendations to eliminate further occurrences.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and issue installed cost estimates for instrumentation improvement projects so that equipment owners can make informed decisions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review, research and recommend instrumentation projects necessary to maintain instrumentation reliability on the process units.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serve as instrument engineer for process hazard analysis (PHA) and Layers of Protection Analysis (LOPA) Meetings.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>This position combines an understanding of I&amp;E engineering principles, and refinery unit operations and overall profitability to assure that these systems function properly.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The incumbent continually evaluates the rapidly changing instrument field to assure that the refinery selects the most modern, cost-effective, compatible equipment for new and retrofit projects. This person fosters a customer service attitude to provide the refinery with leadership in the instrument field and takes a leadership position in sharing information in this field with all interested parties at the refinery and corporate level.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide guidance to the management team in all matters of instrumentation importance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and\u002For update the existing instrumentation engineering standards and establish guidelines for preventative and predictive maintenance activities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Due to the nature of the job there is a risk of exposure to electrical arc blasts, electrical fires and electrical shock, and will require working in all units of the refinery, including hazardous locations.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>\n      <div>\n       <div>\n        <ul>\n         <li>BS Electrical <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Maintenance \u002F Inspection \u002F Technology \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    STRATFORD(CT-USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>BASIC FUNCTION:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> Maintenance Mechanics are primarily responsible for performing preventative and corrective maintenance, troubleshooting equipment, equipment modifications, upkeep of buildings, facilities and properties.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>JOB DIMENSIONS:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> Performs all tasks in a safe manner and complies with all safety rules and policies including those for PPE use.\n    <br> Understands and implements standard operating procedures related to the repair and modification of plant facilities including but not limited to; production equipment, instrumentation, office equipment and plant physical facilities.\n    <br> Performs welding, plumbing, electrical, mechanical and other trade functions.\n    <br> Orders, receives and stores spare parts, maintains plant spare parts inventory systems.\n    <br> Assists in trouble-shooting equipment problems.\n    <br> Reviews the maintenance work lists\u002F work order lists and carries out all job assignments.\n    <br> Completes all preferred maintenance logs and maintenance forms paperwork\n    <br> Follows plant preventative maintenance programs and mechanical integrity programs\n    <br> Performs instrument calibrations as desired\n    <br> Paints and labels piping, vessels, and areas of the building as instructed.\n    <br> Maintains the grounds surrounding the plant by cutting weeds, trimming bushes, picking up trash, etc.\n    <br> Follows all safety procedures in the containing and cleaning up of any small ( 5 gallons) spills of hazardous materials.\n    <br> Assists production, shipping receiving when needed and assists all other departments to ensure overall plant performance.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> Helps ensure a place of employment that is free from recognized hazards by performing all job functions in a safe and prudent manner, complying with all applicable loss control related regulations, complying with the Company’s loss control policy, and reporting unsafe conditions, work-related accidents, injuries or illnesses to Loss Control or to the immediate supervisor. Reviews the work area for potential losses and loss control opportunities and reports them to Loss Control or to the immediate supervisor.\n    <br> Properly uses and maintains personal protective equipment, when provided by the supervisor or Loss Control or desired under applicable regulations.\n    <br> Perform safe work practices to provide for the control of hazards during maintenance operations including but not limited to lockout\u002Ftagout; confined space entry; hot work as necessary, per 29 CFR 1910.119 Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.\n    <br> Support implementation of MAESTRO initiatives as needed\n    <br> Initiates incident reports for injuries, spills, fires, or other property damage, per 29 CFR 1904 Recording and Reporting Occupational Injuries and Illness and Company requirements.\n    <br> Operate a forklift and aerial platform in a safe and prudent manner.\n    <br> Safely lift and carry (for approximately 10-20 feet) heavy objects weighing up to 75 lbs. on an occasional basis.\n    <br> Safely climb ladders (using feet, legs, hands and arms) and work safely at heights (approximately 30 ft.)\n    <br> Wear personal protective equipment, which may include but not be limited to, hart hat, safety shoes, work uniforms, safety gloves, hearing protection, safety eyewear, arc flash accessories and emergency response equipment.\n    <br> Wear dust mask and half\u002Ffull-face air-purifying and supplied air respirator, in the performance of job duties and emergency response team duties.\n    <br> Work in confined spaces, on a periodic basis.\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>CONTEXT AND <\u002Fb>\n    <b>ENVIRONMENT<\u002Fb>\n    <b>:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> The Cray Valley Stratford CT manufacturing facility is a division of TotalEnergies Petrochemicals and Refining USA, Inc. Normal plant production operation is 24 hours, 4 Days with two 8-hour maintenance shifts 5 days per week. This position requires 24 HR \u002F 7 DAY availability(call-ins) to support plant operations. Requires one to be able to handle multiple interactions with many site departments as well a providing support services to the following departments or groups: Production, Shipping Receiving, Quality Control, Process Engineering, Office and Logistics, Operations \u002F HSSE Mgr., and the Safety Committee.\n    <br> \n    <br> Manufacturing environment with chemical, physical, ergonomic, and electrical hazards. Work includes a variety of physical conditions including, but not limited to, proximity to moving mechanical parts and powered industrial trucks, potential exposure to hot work or steam, working with sharp instruments, and working at heights.\n    <br> Work is performed both indoors and outdoors of the manufacturing complex. Worker is subject to both inside and outside environmental conditions, which could include potential exposure normally associated with outdoor conditions (extreme outdoor temperatures, spiders, rodents, etc.).\n    <br> Worker is subject to atmospheric conditions, including, but not limited to, potential exposure to dust, chemicals, and odors.\n    <br> Works with and around hazardous substances.\n    <br> Work may require use of protective clothing and equipment, which may include, but not be limited to, eye protection, head protection, hand protection, respiratory protection, arc flash accessories and foot protection.\n    <br> Scheduled hours may vary in shifts and length.\n    <br> Noise level in the work environment is below the OSHA permissible exposure limits; however, hearing protection is provided by the Company and recommended or preferred in certain areas of the facility.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>QUALIFICATIONS\u002FEXPERIENCE:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> High school diploma or GED equivalent preferred.\n    <br> 5-7 years previous experience in a manufacturing environment preferred.\n    <br> 2-3 years previous experience in a chemical environment preferred.\n    <br> Ability to operate a computer and peripheral equipment\n    <br> Ability to develop multiple tasks and projects concurrently and efficiently.\n    <br> Ability to organize and prioritize work in a timely manner and react well under pressure.\n    <br> Ability to communicate and work as a member of a team.\n    <br> Ability to compute and record data accurately.\n    <br> Ability to work and communicate with other departments, co-workers, customers, vendors and contractors.\n    <br> Computer\u002Fperipheral equipment, calculator, two-way emergency radios, telephone, scales, pumps and mixers, hand tools, packaging equipment, powered industrial vehicles, and a variety of other manufacturing equipment\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>INTERNATIONAL CONSIDERATION:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    66566BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Inspection &amp; Maintenance General Resp., Maintenance Methods Studies, Maintenance\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Workplace location (Precisions\u002FKeywords)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Stratford, Connecticut\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 6 years, Minimum 10 years\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Refining &amp; <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>ACTIVITIES:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Reviews and approves engineering projects, equipment purchases, plant improvements and process changes. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Provides engineering and technical support to other departments, as necessary.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Supervises maintenance operations ensuring all operations are carried out to comply with company safety &amp; work policies.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Supervises, plans and schedules (including overtime) all tasks and activities associated with maintenance including preventative maintenance, small projects, maintenance work orders and repairs, calibrations and construction projects.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reviews, recommends and develops budgets for maintenance fixed and variable expenses.(ranges around $400K-$600K)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reviews, recommends and develops budgets for capital expenses(ranges from $300K to $500K)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Responsible for development, implementation and maintenance of plant preventative maintenance system, purchase equipment, parts &amp; components, spare parts inventory and department recordkeeping.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serves on company teams as needed for site representation (i.e. CAER, Security, loss control, etc.). <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Attends and participates in Metallic Monomers\u002FZinc Salts Business Team meetings.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Enforces employee policies and procedures to meet corporate and legal requirements.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Responsible for supervision and training of maintenance employees.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensures all maintenance and mechanical integrity programs are carried out according to approved procedures and instruction.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Establish work schedules to meet maintenance department labor requirements for all work activity required.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reviews and approves within delegation of authority (DOA), all maintenance and capital invoices in the SAP system.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensures discipline is fairly administered to all directs. Treats everyone with dignity and respect, without discrimination or bias.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides quality service and assistance to all customers (internal departments), employees and vendors on an ongoing basis.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Have co-responsibilities for the site’s Loss Control Coordinator position.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in LCC meetings, to support the team.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Enforces plant safety rules and ensures the maintenance of good housekeeping in all areas of the facility, in accordance with Company requirements. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Ensure a place of employment that is free from recognized hazards by monitoring all engineering and maintenance job functions to make certain they are being performed in a safe and prudent manner, complying with all applicable loss control related regulations, complying with the Company’s loss control policy, and reporting unsafe conditions, work-related accidents, injuries or illnesses.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in incident investigations as necessary, per 29 CFR 1910.119 Process Safety Management of Highly Hazardous Chemicals.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Initiates and confirms the initiation of incident reports for injuries, spills, fires, or other property damage, per 29 CFR 1904 Recording and Reporting Occupational Injuries and Illness and Company requirements. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Tours plant site regularly, speaking to co-workers and employees in other departments about operations, equipment and facilities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitors monthly maintenance metrics.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Performs\u002Fparticipates in safe work practices to provide for the control of hazards during operations including but not limited to lockout\u002Ftagout; confined space entry; hot work as necessary.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Create and forward weekly report for engineering and maintenance activities and metrics to n+1.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform proactive activities for document management system (TMS)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Responsible for waste management and disposal for maintenance related streams.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Interface and take project engineering\u002Fcapital projects directions from corporate project engineers.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <b> ACCOUNTABILITIES:<\u002Fb>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Supervises overall maintenance operations.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Directs and oversees the site’s maintenance related programs to ensure equipment availability.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Responsible for the maintenance department.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Plans and directs the layout of workflow and workforce utilization within the maintenance department.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Directs and oversees the financial operations for the maintenance department fixed cost budget, general ledger accounts \u002F cost center.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Plans and coordinates the planning, workflow and financial budgets for site’s CAPEX and LTP.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>CONTEXT &amp; ENVIRONMENT:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> This position requires one to be able to handle multiple interactions with many site departments along with supervising a small maintenance department within the Stratford, CT facility. Plant Engineer has a medium level of autonomy while still needing to comply and enforce all the policies and rules from the Company. The plant engineer along with the maintenance department consisting of only 3 individuals executes all activities of the industrial site including but not limited to: preventative maintenance programs, capital projects, mechanical integrity programs, annual calibrations and triennial PSV exchanges. Also provides supports and services to the following departments or groups: Production, Shipping &amp; Receiving, Quality Control, Process Engineering, Office and Logistics, Technical Manager and the Safety Committee.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>QUALIFICATIONS\u002FEXPERIENCE:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> 4-year technical degree (such as, but not limited to, Mechanical\u002FManufacturing\u002FIndustrial Engineering) along with a minimum of 3-5 years of work experience in a manufacturing environment, including: Supervisory Experience, Industrial Chemical Processes a plus.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of OSHA and NFPA (NEC) including NFPA 70E (arc flash)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of safety regulations, safe work practices and safety equipment related to the work.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of industrial chemical processes with emphasis in batch chemical processing, PFD’s (process flow diagrams), P&amp;ID’s (piping &amp; instrumentation diagrams), controls and instrumentation, chemical safety and Process Safety Management.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of the general operation of all auxiliary equipment associated with the manufacturing process (chiller system, boilers, tempered water, exchangers, condensers, dust collectors, baghouses, storage systems, etc.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of the general operation of all plant processes and auxiliary equipment associated with the manufacturing functions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of operations and maintenance of all equipment associated with the production process and general facility maintenance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of supervisory techniques used with medium trained personnel.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge and practical application of budgeting and building a strategic plan.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Previous industrial and supervision experience is required. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Working knowledge of AutoCAD<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Physical ability to tour any part of the plant is required.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Medium autonomy, ability to supervise and motivate a small team with multiple functions and skills.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to travel to other sites several times a year. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <b>INTERNATIONAL CONSIDERATION:<\u002Fb>\n     <br> \n     <br> TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    68100BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Inspection &amp; portfolio of trading counterparts;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Verify traders supply accurate deal-sheets\u002Felectronic download reports for all trades validated within our in-house trading system,(the BOOK);<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure that accurate trading information is represented within the trading BOOK by confirming deals with counterparts and brokers on a daily basis;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitor and verify exchange-traded positions and limits;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reconcile the Company’s open trade equity to daily statements from our clearing houses;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitor and report financial OTC trades to the Dodd-Frank reporting regulators within 24 hours of their execution;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Send invoices to counterparts without exceeding deadlines set within the industry as well as contractually;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reconcile counterpart\u002Fpipeline invoices against the system in liaison with the Operations and Middle Office departments to resolve discrepancies;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Agree with counterparts on settlements, provide timely payment instructions and cash forecast information to the Treasury team, and assist the Accounting team with aged debt reporting and resolution and analyzing accruals;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitor and apply payment terms and netting rules within the Simba and Contract Management systems;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Responsible for pulling\u002Fanalyzing settlement statements within the Simba SMS system;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Check and distribute all confirmations produced by the BOOK Confirmation Module or directly from third-parties and record these against the BOOK using the Confirmation Module and chase all outstanding confirmations on a daily basis ;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Analyze confirmations and settlements of daily executed trades by checking pricing and volume adjustments<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ongoing onboarding of new Counterparts,<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist internally and externally with any Back Office related questions;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in team and individual projects delegated by the Back Office Manager or Supervisor;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support team members and be available to help and mentor junior team members;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Run management reports and ad-hoc analysis<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support, identify, and assist in the implementation of process and systems improvements, from system testing and implementations to desk level processes<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identify and communicate operational risk, define risk mitigating measures and priorities<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <b> Your purpose as a Back Office Analyst is to be accountable for the following:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Accurate and timely processing of confirmations and invoicing\u002Fpayments of all transactions and according to their legal agreements; - Ensuring all entries within the trading book are correct.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Daily checks on open positions and deal transactions –brokers, exchanges &amp; clearers ;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to spot errors in the process of trade Verification;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Effective communications with numerous internal and external parties<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>Context and environment<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Fast paced trading environment requiring you to be able to work both autonomously and as part of a team. Requires strong communication within the team, with other departments and externally.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Both industry and contractual deadlines need to be respected to meet all of the company’s obligations;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reconciliation of discrepancies and resolution of counterpart issues requires the you to be able to seek out information necessary for problem solving.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reporting and monitoring obligations per the Dodd-Frank Act, Sarbanes-Oxley Act and to comply with other rules &amp; regulations require diligence and attention to detail<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>You are someone who possesses the following experience and credentials:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Undergraduate degree in accounting, finance, mathematics or business-related major;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> 1-2 years of experience in a similar function;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of energy commodity markets is highly desirable;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> High levels of analytical and information technology skills, strong Excel skills;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to work under pressure, attention to detail, innovation and change management;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Effective communication skills and customer service mentality.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong attention to detail and a high degree of accuracy are essential skills in an environment where an error can have both financial and reputational ramifications<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong drive to improve processes and systems is necessary alongside good IT skills (Excel\u002FVBA\u002FPython\u002FPower BI). You may be expected to develop new tools to secure and optimize the process and built new reports adapted to the business evolutions<\u002Fli>\n     <li> TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    61120BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Financial Middle \u002F Back Office \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Less than 3 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employer company<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    TotalEnergies Gas &amp; Power North America, Inc. \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Gas Renewables And Power \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p>At TotalEnergies we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger. <br> <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP) is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &amp; demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.<br> <br> Our Culture:<br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation.<br> <br> Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success while ensuring safety in all our operations.<br> <br> We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n containers to proper locations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform equipment clean outs as required.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Sweep, vacuum and clean up the plant area when instructed.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist production, shipping &amp; receiving, and maintenance when needed and assist all other departments to ensure overall plant performance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Comply with all Company policies and procedures <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>REQUIREMENTS:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> High School Diploma or equivalent and 60 College Credit Hours<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> OR<\u002Fb> HS Diploma or equivalent and 5 years recent industry experience<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> OR<\u002Fb> HS Diploma or equivalent and 4 years of military experience<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <b> PHYSICAL DEMANDS:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> Position is considered “heavy work”, defined as exerting 50 to 100 pounds of force occasionally, and\u002For 25-50 of force frequently, and\u002For 10 to 20 pounds of force constantly to move objects. \n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Ability to operate a forklift in a safe and prudent manner.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to safely lift and carry (for approximately 10-20 feet) heavy objects weighing up to 50 lbs. on an occasional basis.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to safely handle drums greater than 300 pounds, with or without drum handling equipment. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Ability to wear dust mask and half\u002Ffull-face air-purifying respirator, in the performance of job duties and emergency response team duties. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <b>WORK ENVIRONMENT &amp; ENVIRONMENTAL CONDITIONS:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Manufacturing environment with chemical, physical, ergonomic, and electrical hazards. Work includes a variety of physical conditions including, but not limited to, proximity to moving mechanical parts and powered industrial trucks, potential exposure to hot work or steam, and working with sharp tools.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Works with and around hazardous substances.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work may require use of protective clothing and equipment, which may include, but not be limited to, eye protection, head protection, hand protection, respiratory protection, arc flash accessories and foot protection. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <b>INTERNATIONAL CONSIDERATION:<\u002Fb>\n     <br> \n     <br> TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    66567BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Inspection &amp; Maintenance General Resp., Inspection, Maintenance Methods Studies, Maintenance\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Workplace location (Precisions\u002FKeywords)<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Stratford, Connecticut\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Fixed term position\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 3 years, Minimum 6 years\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Refining &amp; Chemicals \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p>Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with Total. Gas Renewables And Power \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p>At TotalEnergies we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger. <br> <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> <b>TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP)<\u002Fb> is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &amp; demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.<br> <br> <b>Our Culture:<\u002Fb><br> <br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation.<br> <br> Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success while ensuring safety in all our operations.<br> <br> We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>SUMMARY:<\u002Fb><br> <br> The Market Lead (Community Solar) is responsible for setting and executing on strategy for Community Solar markets that TotalEnergies is pursuing for organic and inorganic development. In this role, you will identify and understand policy and economic drivers and key development milestones in assigned markets, and mobilize direct and supporting team (including project finance, project development, government affairs and engineering) members to achieve those development milestones while maintaining overall responsibility for bringing a portfolio of profitable projects in your assigned market to NTP. Critical to results in your role will be your ability to digest a complete set of policy, economic and technical factors affecting your assigned market, identify critical path items (often with uncertainty and imperfect information) and make prudent investment decisions required to secure project results.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Reporting to TotalEnergies’ Senior Director of Business Development and Strategy, this is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to build upon our decades of results in the DG sector during an exciting period of transition to TotalEnergies. The successful candidate will play a key role in achieving TotalEnergies’ goal of owning and operating 1.5 GW of distributed assets by 2030.<br> <br> <b>RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Liaise with internal government affairs staff and external trade groups \u002F industry organizations to identify and shape new and existing state policy markets for long-term CS project development.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Select and manage external subject matter experienced professionals and software providers to support project site targeting<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Select and manage consultants and development partners to achieve site control on favorable project locations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Partnering with internal engineering and environmental subject matter experienced professionals, select and manage consultants to perform fundamental site diligence to determine project viability (e.g., wetlands delineation, critical issues analyses, environmental site assessments, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Devise and implement on project-specific development plans and budgets, sequencing development activities and spend on interconnection, entitlement and engineering to advance project maturity while closing out risks<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Interface regularly with the engineering team to align technical plans and workflows with development schedules<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Partner with internal analytics and project finance groups to ensure project achieve and maintain desired returns throughout the development process<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Represent the company in in industry working groups, policy forums, and conferences<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Willingness to travel up to 25%<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate sales<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Bachelor’s degree in business, engineering, or related field, or equivalent education and experience, required; MBA or equivalent post-graduate degree preferred<\u002Fli>\n  <ul>\n     <li> Enforce TERUSA Health, Safety, and Environment (HSE) policy in all their responsibilities and ensure that external third parties (EPC firms and consultants) operate in a manner acceptable to TERUSA HSE standards.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manage the review of engineering design packages and SCADA designs to assure compliance with the contract, permits, codes, utility design standards, and plant operating and maintenance requirements.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manages the owner’s engineer and technical consultants of projects in the preconstruction and execution stages of utility-scale renewable projects.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepare design and construction packages for HV substation and PV plant modifications, upgrade and replacement and administrate MOCs for associated changes in the operating plant.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead technical portion of major electrical equipment purchase through the entire procurement cycle, including specification, bid evaluation, contractor qualification, vendor selection, inspection plan development, FAT, and spare parts recommendation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform power system modeling (ETAP) for load flow, short circuit, incident energy, and protective device coordination during the development and operations stage of the project to ensure appropriate equipment ratings and power system performance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide technical support to contractors and vendors during design and construction to resolve technical queries, formal RFIs, and interface issues with TSP, QSE, and ISOs.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepare technical specifications, design basis, concept design, budgetary estimates, and RFP scope of work documents.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Perform technical evaluations of project proposals to ensure conformance to the RFP scope.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide technical direction and support in construction efforts, commissioning, and start-up and assist with troubleshooting or problem-solving required to meet installation deadlines.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work and effectively communicate with a construction team to execute assigned projects.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review and ensure the technical integrity of design packages prior to being issued for construction.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work closely with an electrical specialist to provide technical support for troubleshooting, problem-solving, and failure analysis related to electrical installation failures at TERUSA facilities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepare technical recommendations through the collection, analysis, and summary of data and trends, as well as identify optimization opportunities and initiate plant equipment replacement, improvement, and modification projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <b> ACCOUNTABILITIES:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> Accountable for coordinating with internal and external resources to take a project from early concept to final installation and ensure the final electrical design will be safe, reliable, constructible, operable, economical, and environmentally sound\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and engineering with an emphasis on Power systems is desirable.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> 6+ years of Electrical Engineering experience, preferably with the owner and operating company experience.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong knowledge of electrical transmission and power distribution systems in industrial environments and experience supporting electrical design throughout all project phases, including pre-FEED, FEED, detailed design, procurement, construction, and operation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> PE or P. Eng license is required.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Solid understanding of relevant codes and standards (e.g., IEEE, NETA, NEC, NFPA 70E).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Proficiency with power system modeling (ETAP or SKM)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge of PV plant design and value engineering concepts.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Proven ability to handle multiple assignments simultaneously, set realistic goals, and complete commitments on schedule.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Possess excellent communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Proven ability to anticipate, assist, and respond quickly to business unit needs that affect safe and reliable operations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Demonstrated ability to work independently with minimum supervision, self-starting and proactive, and has strong organizational skills.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> US work permit.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <b> INTERNATIONAL CONSIDERATION:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    68098BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Inspection &amp; <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>Join our affiliate TEEEPRT in Houston!<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> Over the past years, numerous studies (e.g., IAE&lt; IPCC) have shown the requirement for carbon dioxide removal(CDR technologies in order to not overshoot the 1.5 degree C temperature increase. The estimated amount of CO2 to be removed changes depending on the source but will certainly reach the giga-tonne scale. In order to achieve its ambition to reach net zero by 2050, TotalEnergies has put in place a challenging CCUS R&amp;D program. Among the different strategies considered, several CDR projects focused on Direct Air Capture(DAC) have been launched and are currently managed at TEEPRT(Houston, TX, USA).<\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> <\u002Fp>\n    <p>You will support the team on different projects covering DAC and other Negative Emissions Solutions(NES). One of the objectives is to test and use a cost estimation tool, developed by TotalEnergies and its partner, to understand the DAC cost reported in the literature. A parametric study will be performed in order to identify the dominant cost items and the R&amp;D axes to prioritize(electrification, centralized regeneration electrochemical processes, ...). Other NES such as Direct Ocean Capture (DOC) and Biomass Carbon Removal and Storage(BiCRS) will be evaluated through technology scouting, understanding the current regulations and incentives and study of the potential market for TotalEnergies.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Apply #JT<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Human Resources \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    HOUSTON-LOUISIANA STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>BASIC FUNCTION:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> The primary responsibility of this position is to support the day-to-day administration of TOTAL’s benefit programs to insure compliance with governmental regulations and required filings.\n    <br> Responsible for assisting with the resolution of employee and retiree benefit issues and providing support for benefits related special projects.\n    <br> Responsible for the financial aspects of the Health &amp; Welfare program, reporting quarterly results and working with consultants on the annual funding rates and pricing.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>JOB DIMENSIONS:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Support the administration and implementation of the benefits plans for the US based Total Affiliates Health and Welfare Program to ensure compliance with government regulations and resolution of benefit plan questions\u002Fissues.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support the administration of the Group CDH activities that include monitoring and providing resolution to employee issues related to the Flexible Spending Accounts and Health Savings Accounts for all members of the US based Total Affiliates Health and Welfare Program.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support the administration of the Total Affiliates Retiree Health Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA) Plan.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support budget analysis of the H&amp;W plans and perform a quarterly reconciliation of H&amp;W claims against payments. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <b>RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Support employees and retirees enrolled in the Total Affiliates Health and Welfare Program and various vendors who support the program to ensure resolution of participant benefit plan issues and administration issues. This includes working with various vendors to ensure HRIS\u002FPayroll file transfers are completed in an accurate timely manner and employee deductions are accurate.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Support local site HR contacts for TPRI, E&amp;P, MS affiliates and Hutchinson for their employees enrolled in the Total Affiliates Health and Welfare Program<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Coordinate the annual enrollment communications campaign and ongoing and ad-hoc employee benefits related communications for active employees in the US based Total Affiliates Health and Welfare Program and develops retiree communications in-house for the Total Affiliates Retiree Health Plan<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Coordinate and implement the annual wellness activities for the US based Total Affiliates Health and Welfare Program between multiple vendors<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Compile and communicate retiree medical and life insurance counts and documentation for Retiree Welfare Plan Valuation on an annual basis <\u002Fli>\n      <li>Administer the Long Term Disability program for all RCA, POL and TCV employees to ensure compliance with Company policies. Assist RCA, POL and TCV HR contacts at site locations with disability issues as requested. <\u002Fli>\n      <li>Assist on benefits related special projects, as needed<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Completes annual benefit surveys for benchmarking benefit plans against competitors<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Submit and track Medicare Part D subsidy<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Coordinate control group testing with affiliates<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Updates Summary Benefit Plan Descriptions for all health and welfare plans as needed on an annual basis<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Coordinates and verifies the Form 1095 reporting for the Affordable Care Act on an annual basis<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Coordinates and compiles health plan counts for Form 5500 filings on an annual basis<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>CONTEXT &amp; ENVIRONMENT<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> This position receives a high volume of telephone calls from employees requesting benefits information and assistance in resolving escalated benefit issues that require coordination with the various benefits vendors. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Must be able to multi-task, as position often requires managing multiple projects simultaneously<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The incumbent in this position should have knowledge of legislation affecting benefit plans (ERISA, COBRA, HIPAA, Section 125 and ACA requirements) to ensure the plan is compliant will all governmental regulations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Excellent organization skills are necessary with a strong attention to detail. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>The incumbent must be able to think through complex situations and relate those situations to the plan documents to identify issues quickly.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Completion of projects in an effective, timely and satisfactory manner.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <b> QUALIFICATIONS:<\u002Fb>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Bachelor Degree in a HR, Finance, Accounting or business related discipline preferred<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Proficiency with Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint and SAP required<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Strong organizational, and communications skills<\u002Fli>\n      <li> 2 to 3 years experience with health and welfare administration preferred<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Must be customer-service oriented, detail-oriented and possess the ability to multi-task multiple projects.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n     <b> INTERNATIONAL <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Operations\u002FExploitation \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    PORT ARTHUR-PORT ARTHUR REFINERY(TX-USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    The Basic Function of a Process Support Engineer is to provide technical support to Operations, Optimization, Facilities Development group, corporate, or any other group that needs unit information. Also troubleshoot, monitor unit performance, and provide recommendations to improve profitability and reliability of unit operations.\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Daily Monitoring- (Ensure compliance with Environmental permits, ensure reliable operation and on-spec product, and search for problems that could prevent the ability to maintain capacity). Support environmental department (emissions calculations)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Troubleshooting- (pressure surveys, temperature surveys, identifying and correcting potential problems, determining need and frequency of exchanger cleaning and means of cleaning (during shut down or partial shut down), economic impact of these shut downs and technical support for operating conditions during partial shut down).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Engineering calculations- (Size orifice plates, size control valves, size relief valves, size restriction orifices, calculate pressure drops, size piping for small projects, perform heat\u002Fmaterial balances, size\u002Frate heat exchangers, calculate fluid properties, determine system volumes\u002Fresidence times)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Mass\u002Fvolume balance- (Update spreadsheet for material balances, ensure orifice calculations reflect current operating conditions and are otherwise correct, calibrate or rearrange meters if necessary, and provide recommendations to correct mass\u002Fvolume balance discrepancies.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Make recommendations to Operations on: following safe work practices while maintaining quality, complying with environmental permits, ensuring reliable operation, making on-spec product, maintaining capacity, and increasing profitability.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support turnaround\u002Fmaintenance activities such as: Catalyst unloading\u002Floading supervision, chemical cleaning supervision, vessel inspection, shutdown\u002Fstartup coverage, including revision\u002Fdevelopment of operating procedures, sample procurement, and recommendations for maintenance (exchanger cleaning, screen cleaning, ect.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Additional Responsibilities: Evaluate economics to determine profitable modes of unit operation, Lead\u002Fparticipate in Process Hazards Analyses, Define and execute small (non-capital) projects, Assist groups with captial project design and installation<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitor unit catalyst performance and issue catalyst life projections; Evalute new proposed catalyst systems; recommend and intitiate procurement process for new catalyst<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain working material balances for delegated operating units<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure that refinery quality and safety initiatives are carried out in daily activities<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Responsible for process technical support of delegated units at the Port Arthur Refinery.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitor\u002Ftrack unit performance with outside unit observation, pressure\u002Ftemperature surveys, Microsoft Excel, PI Process Book, TDC Control System, and process simulator software<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Troubleshoot and make recommendations for any operating problems that may arise on the delegated units<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Technical process support of delegated units<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Potential work around: high heat, hazardous chemicals, and caustic, heavy noise<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Respond to unit upsets and offer recommendations during off hours and holidays<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor of Science, Chemical Engineering and 0-3 years experience preferably in petroleum refining as a process technical service, or design engineer (under 1 year requires 2 internships)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Chemical Engineering knowledge: heat transfer, mass transfer, fluid operations, heat\u002Fmaterial balances, chemistry, physics, economic fundamentals. <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Activities are included but limited to:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Daily Monitoring- Ensure reliable operation and on-spec product, and search for problems that could prevent the ability to maintain capacity and support environmental department.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Troubleshooting- pressure surveys, temperature surveys, identifying and correcting potential problems, determining need and frequency of exchanger cleaning utilizing root cause analysis to eliminate repeat deviations and failures.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Engineering calculations- size control valves, size relief valves, size pumps, calculate pressure drops, size piping for small projects, perform heat\u002Fmaterial balances, size\u002Frate heat exchangers, calculate fluid properties, determine system volumes\u002Fresidence times.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Mass\u002Fvolume balance – Update spreadsheet for material balances. Ensure calculations reflect current operating conditions and are correct. Provide recommendations to correct mass\u002Fvolume balance discrepancies.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Make recommendations to Operations on: Following safe work practices while maintaining quality, ensuring reliable operation, making on-spec product, maintaining capacity, and increasing profitability.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Make data driven recommendations to management for issue resolution and process and site improvements.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support turnaround\u002Fmaintenance activities such as: Chemical cleaning supervision, vessel inspection, shutdown\u002Fstartup coverage, including revision\u002Fdevelopment of operating procedures, sample procurement, and recommendations for maintenance (exchanger cleaning, screen\u002Ffilter cleaning, etc.).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Additional Responsibilities: Act as site MOC Administrator, initiate MOCs, and lead\u002Fparticipate in Process Hazards Analysis, PSSR, HAZOP, LOPA, Track PHA\u002FLOPA findings. Define and execute small (non-capital) projects, assist groups with capital project designs and installation;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Determine best process improvements to produce specialty products.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead analytical projects to optimize asset performance and reduce bottlenecks. Maintain availability\u002Freliability tools and analysis; provide data and presentation material for weekly and monthly reports.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain professional relationship with LYB site operations to facilitate optimization of plant performance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understand, support, and comply, with all plant safety policies and procedures, including the use of loss control software.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identify activities to enhance profits and positive cash flow (currently $8MM\u002Fyr).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide leadership for reliability and improvement projects in supporting the annual project budget ($3MM\u002Fyr).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> In the absence of the Plant Manager, manage all aspects of the plant, including D of A assignment and decision-making authority.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Technical process evaluation, plan development, implementation, and support across the unit.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Potential work around: high heat, hazardous chemicals, and caustic, heavy noise.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Respond to unit upsets and evaluation, plan development, implementation, and offer recommendations during off hours and holidays.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Management support and teammate responsibility coverage.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor of Science, Chemical Engineering, and 8+ years chemical engineering experience in the petrochemical or refining industry preferred as a process, technical service, or design engineer<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Chemical Engineering knowledge: heat transfer, mass transfer, fluid operations, heat\u002Fmaterial balances, chemistry, physics, economic fundamentals, and basic chemical engineering fundamentals, required.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Computer knowledge: use of Microsoft software including spreadsheets (i.e. Excel), DCS control data historians (i.e. PI Process book), and be able to understand new systems as they come (i.e. SAP)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Good problem-solving skills; good physical fitness as job requires access on\u002Finto towers, vessels, and other equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work evenings\u002Fnights during turnarounds or other special circumstances where 24-hour technical coverage is needed.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Interpersonal and communication skills required for interaction with every group in the facility and with vendors.<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b><i> This position requires Non-U.S. Persons to receive an International Traffic and Arms Regulations license approved from the Department of State. As stated on <\u002Fi><\u002Fb>22 C.F.R. §126.1<b><i>(d)(1), certain countries have a presumption of denial on the license, and therefore be unable to perform the required job duties.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><br> <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Additional Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>The job position is a process engineer for a 23MM lbs per year Polybutadiene Facility, located at the Channelview 2, Cray Valley manufacturing site.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Responsible for process technical support of the PolyBD unit and other activities related to CV2 owned assets; monitor\u002Ftrack unit performance, Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, PI Process Book, SAP, Documentum<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The position provides daily support and input to monitor, measure, optimize and improve the production process <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Provides support and direction to 3rd party site service provider (LYB) on contractual matters, contract valued at $10MM\u002Fyr<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Leads the MOC process for TotalEnergies Cray Valley in regard to LyondellBasell process and equipment change requirements<\u002Fli>\n     <li><i> Acting Plant Manager during times of Plant Manager absences, including covering as primary contract manager contact with LyondellBasell, month end close, and management reporting <\u002Fi><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    62856BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Downstream Operations \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 6 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Refining &amp; (combustion optimization, identification of energy losses, insulation integrity, heat recovery improvements).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Organizes and runs performance surveys of Heaters and Boilers (field measurements of IR temperatures, pressures, flue gas composition, and measurement of heater fuel efficiency).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Contributes to the reliability and to the availability of the balances.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepares the monthly reports for the Heaters (performances, KPI) and supports central network need for plant data.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in the preparation equipment under his\u002Fher responsibility (turnaround report, documentation).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Insures the technology watch of its equipments. Manages and organizes the classification of the documentation linked to this technology watch.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in the training of the personnel responsible for the operation and optimization of fired equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in the development and the perpetuation of the specific technical knowledge in the area of combustion with the Operations and Process Support teams.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in the analyses of incidents and accidents (HSEQ).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participates in projects in the area of combustion (definition of requirements).<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Provides technical assistance in order to ensure the safe and reliable operation of the fired equipment of the refinery (Heaters, Boilers, Flares) and to improve their global efficiency. Ensures the optimization of the combustion equipment. Participates in the monitoring of the equipment of combustion and advises for in the preparation of maintenance prior and during turn-around.\n    <ul>\n     <li> Number of fired equipment of the refinery = 50<\u002Fli>\n     <li> 1% improvement of Fuel Gas c about 1 M$\u002Fyear<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Interfaces with various groups in the refinery such as Operations, Maintenance, Inspection, Process Support Groups, and Turnaround Team.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Outside interfaces with TOTAL Industrial Division, contractors, engineering companies, suppliers, manufacturers.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Minimum of 10 years experience in Operations, Process Support or Maintenance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Good technical knowledge of combustion, heaters, boilers.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Good communication skills with the ability to motivate and influence others.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to transfer knowledge to Process Support Engineers and Operators.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> The basic function of the Fired Equipment Specialist is to provide the expert technical support in the area of combustion and fired equipment, ensure the optimization and coordinate the technical follow-up of the combustion equipment, and contribute to the continuous improvement of energy efficiency of the Refinery, and to the achievement of a high level of safety and reliability of fired equipment. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> <b>TotalEnergies Trading &amp; Shipping (T&amp;S),<\u002Fb> an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies T&amp;S is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.<br> <br> <b>Our Culture:<\u002Fb><br> <br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition.
