\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    We are currently searching for the head of Risk &amp; Insurance to join the Risk Management and Insurance team (RMI) in the USA. The team consists of 3 people + the Head and operates on a USA interest basis across all TotalEnergies businesses including Joint Venture interest (e.g., Upstream, Downstream, Integrated Gas &amp; Renewable Energy Solutions, Trading and Shipping).\n    <br> This role will be reporting directly to the VP CFO of the TotalEnergies American Services and indirectly to DARA Department in charge of America (Company Risk and Insurance Division) to ensure full alignment with the Risk Management and Insurance strategy globally.\n    <br> The role will be part of the Finance Executive team under CFO management.\n    <br> \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>Job Dimension <\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li>Execute Insurance global strategy define by DARA.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Act as the primary US representative with TotalEnergies (TE) on material Risk Management and Insurance topics. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Responsible for timely and accurate Risk Management and Insurance services for 25 US Affiliates and Joint Ventures representing annual revenues of more than 10B$.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> This position routinely collaborates with the VP CFO finances and CEO \u002F Senior Management of each affiliate. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Support the growth of the renewable’s activities (Solar – Electric Utilities and C&amp;I, Biogas, Offshore Winds) part of TE net zero strategy ambition by 2050. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Maintain adequately and efficiently (price) the insurance coverage for construction and operation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Overseeing TE retention at the affiliates level. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Oversight and stewardship of the claims management (either claims frequency or catastrophic). <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Execute the strategy define at the company level for the Insurance Program (Property and Business Interruption, Construction \u002F OAR for Solar, Excess Casualty, Cargo ...).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Define the targets and detail workflow of the team to ensure that the objectives and deadlines are timely met and within the budget.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Optimize and streamline current process in place (data collection, claims management, process payment). <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Represent TE in the different Risk Management Industry Society in line with DARA guidelines. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Develop and maintain effective relationships with key business leaders to ensure their support of the respective risk and insurance strategies.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Establish and maintain effective relationships with external stakeholders such as brokers, insurers, loss adjusters and joint venture partners.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support continuous improvement of risk financing and insurance solutions through simplification and standardization.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support and use additional resources at the company level (claims, assets evaluation, risk survey ...)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Maintain and develop the communication through the existing platform and the insurance manual.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support TE businesses as well as functions (incl. Legal, Contracting &amp; Procurement, Finance) to negotiate contractual risk allocation and insurance provisions across different types of contracts with third parties including strategic procurement contracts, storage, and transportation contract, PPA, joint venture agreements, EPC...<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Organize and facilitate a stewardship insurance meeting on quarterly basis with the VP CFO of the TotalEnergies American Services and DARA division people (Corporate Risk and Insurance Division) in charge of America to ensure full alignment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Approve purchase orders related to Insurance within the DOA limits.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manage and track the budget execution.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>What we need from you:<br> <\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>Required Education &amp; Experience:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> BBA in Finance \u002F Legal with risk management emphasis and professional certificates in risk and insurance management<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Minimum 10 years of relevant experience (Experience in a risk management department of a corporation\u002Finsurance broker\u002F brokerage house preferred) <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Existing ARM OR CPCU Certification or intent to pursue certification a plus.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Fluency in English; additional language skills may be an advantage.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <b> Required Technical Skills:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Comprehensive understanding of the energies sector including renewables<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong finance and risk management background (from risk mitigation \u002F risk control either technical or contractual to risk transfer and claims management) <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Knowledge in the captive area a + <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Experience with Risk Management Information Systems a + as the RMI is expanding the RMIS functionality<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <b> Required Behavior Skills:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Excellent communication skills, negotiation, and management skills <\u002Fli>\n     <li>The role involves regular engagement with different external and internal stakeholders across different businesses, functions, and levels in the organization. The ability to set and manage priorities, influence, and persuade stakeholders at senior levels (both internal and external to TotalEnergies) is critical to succeed in this role.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong organizational &amp; time management skills<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Exceptional interpersonal with demonstrable ability to establish rapport &amp; interact positively with internal clients<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Detail oriented with ability to maintain focus through completion of projects.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <b><i> TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    67600BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Taxes Customs &amp; Insurance \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 10 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Refining &amp; Chemicals \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p>Every day, our employees around the world live out our ambition to be a world-class player in the energy transition while relying on cutting-edge expertise that spans the entire chain of energies: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 100,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, cleaner, more reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, we put sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of our projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<\u002Fp>\n and documentation for all electrical systems at the refinery to achieve refinery performance objectives.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The incumbent continually evaluates the rapidly changing electrical power field to assure that the refinery selects the most modern, cost-effective, compatible equipment for new and retrofit projects. This person fosters a customer service attitude to provide the refinery with leadership in the electrical field and takes a leadership position in sharing information in this field with all interested parties at the refinery and corporate level.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The incumbent is the technical advisor to the refinery’s capital project group for the design of the electrical facilities and the specification of electrical equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serve as the technical power expert for the refinery complex. Provide guidance and direction to the management team in all matters of electrical importance, especially in the areas of power reliability within and outside the refinery’s electrical system.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Must be able to communicate effectively about electrical issues to other technical non-electrical personnel in a manner that ensures a thorough understanding of any electrical power issues.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and\u002For update existing electrical engineering standards and establish guidelines for preventative and predictive maintenance activities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work closely with the public utility to ensure that the electrical system providing power to the refinery is reliable<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>BS Electrical Engineering with a minimum 5+ years of progressive experience in a petrochemical facility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge and experience in ISA, ANSI, NEC, NESC, IEEE, and OSHA 1910 standards as they apply to electrical equipment and safe work practices.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong working knowledge of SEL, Multilin, and Basler Relays.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong working knowledge of SKM software in order to perform short circuit analysis, motor starting studies, and arc flash studies.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience in the application of protective relaying.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience in the design and trouble-shooting of electrical switchgear and controls for voltages from 480v to transmission voltages.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge in the repair and control of both induction and synchronous motors.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Competent in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience in the use and interpretation of data collected with standard electrical test equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> This position requires daily interface with many disciplines within the refinery, with special emphasis on the ability to successfully communicate technical electrical issues to non-electrical personnel in order to assist them in making sound and safe decisions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to lead by example, logical problem solving skills, works well in team environment, able to manage multiple\u002Fchanging priorities<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Additional Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    This position is a ladder position, Bands 1-3. codes.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide inspection support to ensure compliance with State and Federal laws by establishing records, conducting inspections, and assisting audits by regulatory agencies Confined space entry is most hazardous. Inspectors may be required to provide support to other Total facilities worldwide.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> This position is on call 24 hours a day. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Finance \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    HOUSTON-LOUISIANA STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    TotalEnergies Special Fluids are solvents and specialty hydrocarbon fluids marketed across the world. This USA-based role is responsible for analyzing the Special Fluids supply activity, coordinating the Price Risk Management strategy and its implementation, and liaising with the commercial team both domestically and in the AME affiliates to ensure forecasts are validated with supply capabilities.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>Responsibilities include:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Forecast Management &amp; Communication, Daily\n      <ul>\n       <li> Updates purchases &amp; sales in “Medissys” with forecast volumes, and communicate volume adjustments to the middle office as needed.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Monitors &amp; reports variance between forecast and updated projections and realizations on an as-needed basis (weekly minimum).<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Participates in weekly Production \u002F Sales Meetings and communicates key data to stakeholders related to hedging efficiency strategy.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Ensures all sales conducted are tracked and hedged appropriately in line with SF Market Risk Committee directives.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li> Forecast Preparation Activities, Monthly\n      <ul>\n       <li> Prepare for the “Month M+1 Program” after receiving the consolidated sales forecasts from the commercial analyst.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Agrees with supply &amp; production to allocate products according to forecast. Communicates confirmation of sales forecast to all parties. Updates supply allocation according to mid-month forecast updates and rules established by the business.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Communicate to Commercial Analyst outcome of “Month M+1 Program” and explain the tendencies (short, long …). <\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li>Hedging Program Activities, Daily\n      <ul>\n       <li> Monitor daily priced positions and provide daily data needed to maintain the exposure at the reference level. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Calculate and valuate open positions with forward curves and provide Operations with market analysis related to these positions<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Monitor the daily position and determine the amount for the daily hedge orders. Maintain database of all physical and paper transactions including but not limited to futures, swaps, &amp; EFPs. <\u002Fli>\n       <li>Validate trades and contract information against inputs in the trading software.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li> Hedging Program Activities, Monthly\n      <ul>\n       <li> Special attention is required for trading effects analysis and the impact on our monthly results (roll, forecast errors, stocks).<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Reconciles physical and pricing position at month-end reconciles open papers.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Reconcile month-end invoicing from trading activity and provide necessary entries for accounting.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Responsible for the distribution of pricing information to necessary stakeholders on an ad hoc and routine basis. Various reporting tasks as required on an ad hoc basis to support the needs of management.<\u002Fli>\n       <li> Steward all aspects of TEMUSA Risk Management policies. Includes authorization levels observed (physical and paper position and risk exposure versus the authorized limits), segregation of duties among all the stakeholders, and approved reference inventories are in place.<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n     <li> Other Responsibilities\n      <ul>\n       <li> Supports the shared services business analyst during the SF business yearly Long-Term Plant development<\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Responsibilities for Commercial decisions is held by the National Sales Manager for US domestic Sales, Central American Manager for sales in Central America and the Business Developer for the AME business. This role is intended to analyse and advise the commercial activity, not to make commercial decisions. \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s Degree; Preferred focus in Business or Finance<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Minimum of 3 years professional experience; Preferred finance experience \u002F Financial acumen knowledge<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Elevated analytical skills; data analysis, trending, interpreting<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Detail oriented – pays attention to detail and produces work consistently with accuracy<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Must be well organized with work and time management to meet firm deadlines<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Able to communicate successfully at all levels within the organization and across different departments<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Advanced Excel skills; SAP knowledge desired; IT IS systems savvy<\u002Fli>\n     <li> French speaking preferred <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    62287BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Financial Middle \u002F Back Office \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 3 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Refining &amp; Chemicals \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p>Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with Total. Americas and provide performance analysis for budget and long-term planning. Month end reporting requires flexibility with schedule in order to meet Division and Branch deadlines.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Routinely interfaces with geographically dispersed colleagues with remote-working applications<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b><i>TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb><br> <br> At TotalEnergies American Services we know that you're more than what's on your CV. USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <b>Join our affiliate TotalEnergies E&amp;P USA, Inc. in Houston!<\u002Fb>\n     <br> \n     <br> You will work with cutting-edge technologies, learn from experienced professionals, and contribute to the production of extremely challenging deep offshore fields.The company portfolio in the USA is made of OBO onshore and offshore assets with very diverse subsurface characteristics and various degrees of maturity.\n     <br> \n     <br> Our mature brownfields require thorough synthesis of all available subsurface information and efficient teamwork aimed at unlocking future opportunities. As a part of our team, you will also witness greenfields going on stream and follow up the exciting results of first production. Together with the Operator, we will calibrate our understanding of the field behavior based on these observations and adjust development strategy accordingly.\n     <br> \n     <br> Your missions will be:\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Analyze and validate geological data;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Define depositional models, based on cores, logs, and analogues in collaboration with our experts;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure the synthesis of all static data;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Construct geological models;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure the proper evaluation of volumes in place and the associated uncertainties;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in the dynamic synthesis with the Reservoir Engineers;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure proper storage of geological data and studies into the field reference database;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in subsurface studies to define the reservoir plan of development or the appraisal program;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Follow-up HPHT drilling operations, and ensure the acquisition of subsurface data;<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Support the accomplishment of well objectives.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <br> This position is an excellent opportunity to develop not only your technical, but also communication skills while presenting, discussing and influencing the optimization of production at technical workshops with our partners.\n     <br> \n     <br> \n     <b>Apply #JT<\u002Fb>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Strategy Economics Business \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    HOUSTON-LOUISIANA STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>Your missions as a Market Analysis America include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b> Oversee data collection and processing used in the Americas oil balances (supply\u002Fdemand\u002Ftrade):<\u002Fb> Ensure consistency of historical data sources with the research team's Global Oil Balance for crude and product balance. Direct improvement, where and when required, of data collection processes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Short-term U.S. oil product balances:<\u002Fb> Produce weekly U.S. oil balances for major oil products. This involves forecasting product demand and supply and tracking trade (imports\u002Fexports) by PADD. This will include coordination with the refinery analyst in Geneva relative to the assumptions used in refining (identifying available CDU capacity, operating rates of functional capacity and assumptions on product yields).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Oversee and manage junior crude oil analyst in Houston:<\u002Fb>In cooperation with the Global Coordinator of crude oil analysis, oversee and manage the work of the junior crude oil analyst in the production of weekly U.S. crude oil balances, monthly forecasting of US, Canada and Mexico crude and condensate supply.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Oversee and manage graduates: <\u002Fb>Oversee and manage the work of graduates in Houston during their 6-month rotation with the market analysis team. This involves coaching and training graduates to produce oil product balances for Latin American and Caribbean countries.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Disseminate market analysis through dedicated Microsoft TEAMs forums and email alerts: <\u002Fb>Disseminate research, market trends, and market news pertinent to the Americas region (including their potential price impacts where relevant) to the trading desks (physical and derivatives) to allow them to react promptly to changes in market conditions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Maintain \u002F Develop regular qualitative and quantitative reports: <\u002Fb>Including but not limited to the weekly API statistics report, the pre and post-weekly US EIA statistics reports, and the U.S. rack sales charts report for gasoline and diesel.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Data visualization dashboards:<\u002Fb> Develop or direct desk analyst reports to build\u002Fimprove data visualization dashboards (Power B.I.) with the evolving needs of the trading desk and the broader research group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Feed the Americas oil balances to product desk analysts in Geneva<\u002Fb> for aggregation and preparation of the market analysis team's global oil balance for publication in the monthly Global Market Outlook and Performance Committee presentations. Incorporate feedback, and make amendments to demand forecasts when required to finalize the team's global oil balance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Manage the regional share drive to ensure business continuity and the preservation of corporate knowledge: <\u002Fb>Ensure consistency of the structure of the Houston share drive (organization of folders, sub-folders, and files) with that of the Geneva share drive. Ensure that no research analysis is developed, implemented, or conducted in the personal drives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><b><br> Relay analysis produced in other locations: <\u002Fb>Ensure local awareness of the analysis produced by desk analysts in other regions.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b><br> Promote\u002Ffoster a culture of inclusiveness, collaboration, and respect for TotalEnergies' conduct rules.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b><br> Purpose <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b>Prepare U.S. oil product balances, and oversee oil product balances for the Americas.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b> Manage\u002Foversee junior analysts in Houston.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b> informational requests from the research team and the trading desks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b> Manage the Houston market analysis share drive<\u002Fb> to ensure consistency with the Geneva share drive architecture to maintain business continuity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b>Working to tight deadlines:<\u002Fb> Promptly and precisely update the product oil balances to allow rapid dissemination to the trading desks and the research group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Working autonomously:<\u002Fb> the person must be able to work autonomously while at the same time regularly interacting with the Global Coordinators of crude and product analysis and the Director of oil.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Reactivity<\u002Fb>: In a fast-paced and time-sensitive environment, there is an imperative to react quickly and be proactive in responding to informational demands from the trading desks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Meetings:<\u002Fb> Participate in weekly meetings with the trading desk and the <li><p><b><br> Reporting line:<\u002Fb> while closely working with the trading desks, the position is hierarchically independent and reports to the Director of oil market analysis based in Geneva and locally to the Head of ATMI in Houston.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Under the guidance of the Director of oil market analysis:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Produce slide presentations, reports, and forum posts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Regularly interact with the physical and derivatives trading desks for ad-hoc informational <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p>At TotalEnergies we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger. <br> <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> <b>TotalEnergies Trading &amp; Shipping (T&amp;S),<\u002Fb> an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies T&amp;S is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.<br> <br> <b>Our Culture:<\u002Fb><br> <br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation.<br> <br> Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success while ensuring safety in all our operations.<br> <br> We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Lead development of projects through FEED (Front-End Eng. Design) for the Port Arthur Refinery (PAR), Base Chemicals and BASF-TOTAL Limited Partnership (BTP) assets located at PAR. This includes but is not linited to coordinating project cost\u002Fbenefit studies, developing final project justifications, achieving consensus among the customers and seeking funding approval from management to pursue EPC .<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in profitability improvement programs to evaluate and implement high payout capital projects to improve the PAR, Base Chemicals, and BTP competitive positions, and return on capital employed.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist Project Management (EPC) team on approved projects on detail engineering, construction, commissioned and start-up. This includes participating with customers (Base Chemicals, BTP, Logistics, Operations, Optimization, HSE, and Reliability) and Contractors.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop P&amp;IDs that define instrumentation, control and safety system project’s scope. P&amp;IDs must be detailed to allow cost estimation, Hazop and MOC. P&amp;IDs shall include startup permissives, shutdown trips, instrument locations, control logic and Safety functions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Lead and challenge PHA team recommendations to achieve a reasonably residual risk vs scope and cost of DCS\u002FSIF projects. For that, the incumbent coordinate P&amp;ID reviews, bring operational experience on maintainability, response during downgraded escenarios, identify common failure mechanism in DCS and SIS.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Understand, develop and modify: Control narratives, Cause and Effect Matrix, verify SIL rating calculation. Able to team work fluently with Instrumentation, Systems and Controls maintenance teams, PSM (Process Safety Management), Operations, Process Engineering.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Specify design of all engineered items in project such as Instrumentation, DCS, SIS, PLC and SIF.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure that refinery quality and safety initiatives are carried out in daily activities.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Requires the ability to take a problem\u002Fproject description and create a cost effective solution to achieve the stated goal.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Incumbent must know or develop a basic understanding of every process unit in the refinery, including the process control of key variables, the C\u002FE matrix, the main Safety instrument function to mitigate risk of operations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Projects are assigned by Project Development Superintendent based on priorities set by the Project Screening &amp; Steering Committees.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Project development will follow the Total guidelines and will include working with corporate resources and technical experts in Europe.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Incumbent may be called upon to assist troubleshooting unusual operating problems due to the wide background on Instrumentation and control systems.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Challenges include working with various departments to gain consensus and achieve common and separate goals. Other challenges include managing multiple projects that are subject to changing priorities.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>BS in Instrumentation, Controls, Systems or Electronic Engineering.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> 5+ years relevant engineering experience in the Refining or Petrochemicals.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to specify through data sheets new equipment of all types required for project implementation, develop P&amp;IDs, develop Control Narratives, design control logic for DCS and SIS, evaluate SIL rating of SIF and interprete HAZOP report.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Technically fluent, demonstrate commitment, excellence in oral\u002Fwritten communications and have strong time management skills.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Travel (domestic &amp; foreign). <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Logistics \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    CHARLOTTE AMALIE-LINDBERGH BAY(VIR) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Puerto Rico \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>TotalEnergies Marketing Puerto Rico<\u002Fb> is a French multinational company, that has presence in Puerto Rico since 2004 by consolidating its presence in the oil, lubricants, and aviation business. We have a large gas station network with over 230 stations, of which more than 200 are open in Puerto Rico and St. Thomas. Most of the gas stations have a wide range of products and services, such as sale of gasoline, oils, auto care products, convenience stores, oil and filter change areas, car wash area, and accepting the fleet card called “TotalEnergies PASS Card.” In addition, in the lubricants market we have a wide range of products and services with ever-higher performance levels to extend the life of your equipment\u002Fauto and reduce fuel consumption. Our employees and customers are an integral part of our operation for its success. \n    <br> \n    <br> To support our operations, we need a USVI Terminal Operator that supports the USVI team to meet our goals, by being in charge of the refueling of the aircrafts using an appropriate vehicle available in the depot and performing deliveries to the service stations. Also, by being in charge of maintaining the rolling and fixed equipment by preventing it from any damage during the operations and by implementing the preventive maintenance program, while performing, but not limited to the following activities:\n    <br> \n    <ul>\n     <li> Daily, weekly checks on fixed equipment and vehicles.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Preparation of the refueling vehicles. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>The delivery ticket and all equipment and accessories for the delivery and the quality control during the operations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Driving back and forth the refueling vehicles to the apron and delivery of the aircrafts according to instructions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Registering the delivery ticket into the information system and to carry out some administrative tasks.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Receiving and loading of tank trucks.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Align day tank to Loading Rack and monitor inventory level.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conducts aviation product quality control &amp; tanks drainage on a daily basis and record results. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Assists drivers to access\u002Fexit the depot if necessary and assists drivers in tank truck loading\u002Foffloading if necessary.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conduct tank dipping for daily, period of ten days and month end inventory and product transfers.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assists in vessel receipt operation, tank dips, sampling.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Run Flash Point and abbreviated test before discharge and run FP and API during pumping.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conduct alignment of pipeline during receipts.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conduct API tests on Aviation Products during transfer, especially in the absence of the responsible for quality control.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist in meter calibrations and Aviation equipment testing.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist in security aspects especially during no office hours.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> First responders in case of an emergency (spill, fire).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Attend visitors when visited person is not available (radio).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Carry over daily inspection and maintenance routines.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Conduct monthly inventory of package goods. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>All other tasks that could be given by the management.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    To support our operation while performing the tasks mentioned above, the USVI Terminal Operator will be working on an environment that requires:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Work in shifts as the depot operates 24\u002F7, 365 days a year and change of shift on a regular basis.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> In permanent contact with the Operations Supervisor and all personnel involved in airport operations\u002Factivities (VIPA, customers, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work environment constitutes conditions in which operators will be exposed to the elements, heat, rain, hi humidity, dust, as well as hazardous materials, exhaust fumes &amp; hi noise levels and heavy vehicular and aircraft traffic. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Physical demands of the work will require climbing stairs &amp; lifts, pulling &amp; lifting of 15lbs+ above head level on a regular basis and working under stressful conditions during peak hours of the day. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, talk, and hear. Vision abilities required to perform this job include close vision. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. The passage of employees through the work area is average and normal.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> Additionally, ensure that client deliveries are executed while: \n    <ul>\n     <li>Conduct operational tasks for receipt, storage, and delivery of bulk products according to company’s procedures.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participate in the maintenance program execution.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Respect the Health, Safety, Environmental and Quality (HSEQ) program.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    The requirements for this position are as follows:\n    <ul>\n     <li> High School Diploma or equivalent.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Must be able to speak, read, and write in English.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Take on responsibility related to very sensitive operations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Driving experience in heavy equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Good presentation due to direct and frequent contacts with customers.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> CDL and adequate driver’s license <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Basics in computers.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> At TotalEnergies Marketing Puerto Rico (TEMPR), we like to create something special for our team members. Work is why we're here, but the benefits are important as well:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Health Insurance (Health &amp; Dental)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Life Insurance<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Short-term and long-term disability insurance<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Savings Retirement Plan<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Among others<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> TotalEnergies Marketing Puerto Rico requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by the first day of work. We will require you to provide a copy of your COVID-19 Vaccination Record Card.\n    <br> \n    <br> In general, people are considered fully vaccinated 2 weeks after their second dose in a 2-dose series, such as Pfizer o Moderna vaccines, or 2 weeks after a single-dose vaccine, such as Johnson &amp; Johnson’s Janssen vaccine.\n    <br> \n    <br> TotalEnergies Marketing Puerto Rico may provide vaccination exemptions for medical reasons or religious belief. This exemption will be evaluated accordingly.\n    <br> \n    <br> We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and take Affirmative Action to recruit Women, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.\n    <br> \n    <br> To learn more about our company and latest updates, remember to visit our website: www.totalenergies.com.pr\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    66514BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Terminal Operations \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Less than 3 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employer company<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    TotalEnergies Marketing Puerto Rico Corp. \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Marketing &amp; Services \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Salary currency<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    USD\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Interview location<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Puerto Rico\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p>Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with TotalEnergies. Solar markets that TotalEnergies is pursuing for organic and inorganic development. In this role, you will identify and understand policy and economic drivers and key development milestones in assigned markets, and mobilize direct and supporting team (including project finance, project development, government affairs and engineering) members to achieve those development milestones while maintaining overall responsibility for bringing a portfolio of profitable projects in your assigned market to NTP. Critical to results in your role will be your ability to digest a complete set of policy, economic and technical factors affecting your assigned market, identify critical path items (often with uncertainty and imperfect information) and make prudent investment decisions required to secure project results.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> Reporting to TotalEnergies’ Senior Director of Business Development and Strategy, this is an excellent opportunity for the right candidate to build upon our decades of results in the DG sector during an exciting period of transition to TotalEnergies. The successful candidate will play a key role in achieving TotalEnergies’ goal of owning and operating 1.5 GW of distributed assets by 2030.<br> <br> <b>RESPONSIBILITIES:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n development.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Select and manage external subject matter experienced professionals and software providers to support project site targeting<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Select and manage consultants and development partners to achieve site control on favorable project locations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Partnering with internal engineering and environmental subject matter experienced professionals, select and manage consultants to perform fundamental site diligence to determine project viability (e.g., wetlands delineation, critical issues analyses, environmental site assessments, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Devise and implement on project-specific development plans and budgets, sequencing development activities and spend on interconnection, entitlement and engineering to advance project maturity while closing out risks<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Interface regularly with the engineering team to align technical plans and workflows with development schedules<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Partner with internal analytics and project finance groups to ensure project achieve and maintain desired returns throughout the development process<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Represent the company in in industry working groups, policy forums, and conferences<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Willingness to travel up to 25%<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Oversee the design, selection, configuration, maintenance and documentation for all electrical systems at the refinery to support optimum unit operations while minimizing environmental excursions and safety events.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist plant maintenance groups in troubleshooting and repair of electrical equipment and systems and provide training as needed to assure uninterrupted refinery operation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide electrical engineering services for refinery capital and expense projects to insure quality installations that meet refinery standards.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serve as the lead electrical engineer or the project engineer for capital electrical reliability improvement projects with an annual budget in excess of $100MM.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serve as the lead electrical engineer or technical advisor for large and small electrical maintenance projects.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review, research and recommend electrical projects necessary to maintain electrical reliability to the process units.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide day-to-day power system support for all refinery operational units.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>This position combines an understanding of electrical engineering principles, power systems, and refinery unit operations and overall profitability to assure that these systems function properly.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> This person directs the continual design, selection, configuration, maintenance and documentation for all electrical systems at the refinery to achieve refinery performance objectives.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The incumbent continually evaluates the rapidly changing electrical power field to assure that the refinery selects the most modern, cost-effective, compatible equipment for new and retrofit projects. This person fosters a customer service attitude to provide the refinery with leadership in the electrical field and takes a leadership position in sharing information in this field with all interested parties at the refinery and corporate level.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The incumbent is the technical advisor to the refinery’s capital project group for the design of the electrical facilities and the specification of electrical equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serve as the technical power expert for the refinery complex. Provide guidance and direction to the management team in all matters of electrical importance, especially in the areas of power reliability within and outside the refinery’s electrical system.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Must be able to communicate effectively about electrical issues to other technical non-electrical personnel in a manner that ensures a thorough understanding of any electrical power issues.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Develop and\u002For update existing electrical engineering standards and establish guidelines for preventative and predictive maintenance activities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work closely with the public utility to ensure that the electrical system providing power to the refinery is reliable.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> The Basic Function of a Senior Electrical Engineer is to provide electrical technical support and expertise for the process operations, maintenance and capital groups in an effort to maintain reliable electrical service for the refinery. Serve as the primary contact for electrical power matters to these different departments and contract personnel for the refinery. Serve as the project lead on electrical technical projects.\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>BS Electrical Engineering with a minimum 5+ years of progressive experience in a petrochemical facility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge and experience in ISA, ANSI, NEC, NESC, IEEE, and OSHA 1910 standards as they apply to electrical equipment and safe work practices.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong working knowledge of SEL, Multilin, and Basler Relays.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong working knowledge of SKM software in order to perform short circuit analysis, motor starting studies, and arc flash studies.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience in the application of protective relaying.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience in the design and trouble-shooting of electrical switchgear and controls for voltages from 480v to transmission voltages.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Knowledge in the repair and control of both induction and synchronous motors.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Competent in the use of Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience in the use and interpretation of data collected with standard electrical test equipment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> This position requires daily interface with many disciplines within the refinery, with special emphasis on the ability to successfully communicate technical electrical issues to non-electrical personnel in order to assist them in making sound and safe decisions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to lead by example, logical problem solving skills, works well in team environment, able to manage multiple\u002Fchanging priorities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to work additional hours are sometimes required during turn-around or unplanned outages.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Physical ability to climb stairs and ladders in a refinery environment with required PPE.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Be able to work outside in a refinery environment.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Be on call two to three times a week per year.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Minimal travels for meetings, trainings or FAT.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Occasionally lift electrical test equipment weighing up to 25 pounds.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    63553BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Provide engineering support to Operations and Maintenance on an ongoing basis to address daily mechanical operating needs. Work closely with TotalEnergies and contract maintenance personnel to ensure that required repairs and modifications are completed safely using good engineering practices, with minimum equipment downtime and in a cost effective manner.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide engineering support prior to and during scheduled unit shutdowns, and emergency upsets in order to complete all repair and modification items while minimizing downtime and expenses.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work with Inspection and Operations to evaluate and recommend mechanical modifications to existing equipment and specify new equipment to improve refinery operations, efficiency, equipment reliability, safety and environmental performance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure that all modifications are made according to current TotalEnergies specification and procedures, documenting these changes in accordance with TotalEnergies Management of Change policies and OSHA regulations.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identify recurring mechanical problems in process equipment and develop and implement solutions using recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work with Purchasing and vendors to specify and requisition materials and equipment that meet TotalEnergies Engineering Standards in a cost effective manner, while scheduling deliveries to minimize process equipment downtime.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate the detail design development of low cost, scheduled, capital projects within their assigned area of responsibility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide mechanical engineering support for Process Hazards Analysis pertaining to process units within their area of responsibility and participate as a member on the Area Availability Team for delegated units<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide Technical guidance and mentorship to the Ethane Cracker Mechanical Engineer; assist in training plan development<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Works closely and efficiently with many different departments within the complex, including Operations, Maintenance, Inspection, Reliability, T\u002FA, Process Support, Facilities Development, and Management.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Interfaces regularly with Purchasing, Safety, Environmental and Contract personnel. The primary objective is to maintain safe, reliable, efficient and environmentally responsible operation of the varied process units within the individual’s area of responsibility.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide technical assistance on a daily basis to Operations and Maintenance within these process units. In addition to daily responsibilities, the engineer is actively involved in the planning and implementation of scheduled unit turnarounds and storage tank repairs.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> The engineer must have a solid background in mechanical engineering and materials sciences; knowledge of accepted engineering practices and is able to apply this knowledge in the field. This individual must be able to communicate well with field personnel as well as other Technical and Management groups, both verbally and in writing. The engineer must also have the ability to train\u002Fcoach\u002Fmentor less experienced engineers to improve their technical &amp; professional development.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor of Science Degree, in Mechanical Engineering<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li> 10 years Mechanical Engineering experience preferred<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Problem solving abilities utilizing recognized and generally accepted good engineering practices; strong familiarity with technical codes\u002Fstandards<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to efficiently manage multiple projects and priorities simultaneously<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Good oral, written, communication, interpersonal, and troubleshooting skills<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Requires climbing to elevated heights on equipment. It also requires entering equipment during turnarounds or shutdowns<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Requires occasional weekend and night work for support of turnarounds or shutdowns<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Additional Information<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    This position reports to the \n    <i>Superintendent - Mechanical Engineering <\u002Fi>within the Mechanical organization of the Port Arthur Refinery. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Finance \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    LINDEN-NORTH STILES STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>Job Dimensions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> The <b>Manager<\u002Fb> <b>of MS Financial Control &amp; Reporting <\u002Fb>operates as the right-hand of the Managing Director of TotalEnergies Marketing USA (TEMUSA). In this role you will propose the financial strategy of the affiliate to the Managing Director in accordance with the MS AME Zone policies, and ensure that all finance related processes, procedures, roles and responsibilities are properly in place to allow the strategy to be successfully implemented and carried out. Liaise with the MS Strategy &amp; Business Support team at Paris headquarters to introduce, analyze, and develop high impact projects within TEMUSA which will grow market share and strengthen the company’s financial contribution to TotalEnergies Define and develop a plan to mitigate the risks in the Lubricants market both in the United States as well as all of North and South America. Serve as the primary U.S. representative for all financial issues within the MS Branch, as a member in the TEMUSA Management Committee, and as an Officer of TEMUSA. Responsible for providing and presenting accurate and timely financial results regarding current period operations, Long Term Plan, Forecasting, and Budgeting for 3 Business Units, Lubricants (US Domestic, Canada &amp; Worldwide for Glass), Aviation and ACS, all of which comply with the strategy which has been defined for the affiliate.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> TEMUSA’s Logistics Network consists of several company operated Lubricants warehouses, third party blenders and warehouses, jet fuel storage\u002Fairports, and numerous storage locations and warehouses. This network services approximately 1,000 active customers and produces approximately 1,500 different materials and 20kt of production volume each year.<\u002Fp>\n    <p> The Finance Manager routinely collaborates with the VP Finance for TotalEnergies American Services (TEAS), MS Senior Management and MS AME Zone. This position manages and directs the activities for a team of 5 employees (2 in Houston and 1 in Linden) plus contractors as needed within an annual operating budget of $1m+. In addition, has an indirect managerial relationship with several other positions within the TEAS country services structure and the Manilla Shared Service Centre, managing the MS activity performed by personnel within key departments including Treasury, Accounting, Accounts Payables, Internal Control, Tax, and Risk Management.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <p><br> As the Manager of MS Financial Control &amp; Reporting your primary activities will include:<\u002Fp>\n    <p><b> Strategy, Organization, and Structure<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Manage the relationship between Marketing &amp; Services (TEMUSA) and the US Country Services to 1) ensure the proper application of the Service Level Agreement between TEMUSA and the US Shared Services, 2) manage data collection and exchange for assurance of proper recognition and reporting.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Compile and present at the monthly Management team meeting, a concise and relevant overview regarding the progress toward the achievement of financial and operating goals by the company and the Business Units.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serve as the main contact for the AME, MS Finance Department, global Lubmarine &amp; Aviation businesses.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Oversee validation of billing of fees to Clean Energy (Total Marketing Services, TEMUSA’s 100% parent, owns 25% of Clean Energy's stock) for TOTAL employees contracted and bank guarantee line of credit utilization and communicate M&amp;S fees and expenses to MS Zone AME Finance Management.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b> Financial Control and Reporting<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Optimize the MS Financial Control &amp; Reporting team. Motivate, train and develop the team through clear departmental and individual objectives, skills development and consistent performance evaluation feedback.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure monthly, quarterly and annual reporting is accurate, timely and in conformity with Group rules and that operational reporting of Business Unit activities, both TEMUSA and AME Head Office, is accurate and relevant for the business teams.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Challenge and monitor Fixed and Variable costs, Capital expenditures and Work-in-Progress<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Work with the TEMUSA MD and teams to prepare the Long-Term Plan and annual Budget: Coordinating all submissions, detailed analysis and presentations<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure Lubricants Business Analyst, based in Linden, provides the appropriate support to the Lubricants business line for production, sales and cost analytics<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure adherence of the annual Management Incentive Plan and the quarterly Sales Incentive Plans.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist Middle-Office in preparing appropriate hedging and analytical support for the Aviation.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b> Compliance and Governance<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Serve on the TEMUSA Inventory Committee, providing a clear view of the financial implications of inventory adjustments, staying up to date on all physical counts, and approving all requested inventory adjustments.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure that annual SOX reviews and audits are performed and completed in a timely manner and in compliance with all rules and regulations. Develop and carry out a resource management plan so that each team member contributes to the process of completing audits and providing relevant, thorough information to auditors so that TEMUSA is in full compliance at all times.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Serve on the Contract Committee to review and validate all RFPs.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure corporate Governance &amp; Compliance Rules related to finance activities are duly implemented and followed<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Coordinate with TEMUSA &amp; US Finance Country Services Teams for the IFRS and US GAAP financial audits<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Direct daily interaction with the affiliate’s Managing Director and business managers as well as the Marketing &amp; Services Zone office. The entity has undergone major organizational changes in the past years; implementation of significant hedging activities for aviation; the implementation of the country services structure and the Shared Service Centre in Manilla, the reactivation of the Rockingham Lubricant Blending plant.\n    <p><b><br> Purposes<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p> Your effective performance by the job holder of this position will produce the following outcomes: 1) clear understanding by Senior Management of the results of the company, explanations for variation to budget and historical activity; 2) define and implement strategic and operating decisions; 3) effective, controlled and reliable information system environment that supports business needs; 4) efficient interaction with the US Country Service teams and the Manilla SSC ; 5) compliance with the Group best practices and conformity program; 6) utilizing clear and consistent communication, lead all team members toward goal of carrying out all five of Total’s core values.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    You should consider applying if you meet the following criteria:\n    <ul>\n     <li><b> Education \u002F Training: <\u002Fb>Graduate Degree in Finance and\u002For Accounting<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> Experience:<\u002Fb> 10-15+ years broad financial, accounting and administrative experience including supervision of professional level staff. (Prior experience with Total Group Rules is highly desirable)<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> Skills:<\u002Fb> Exceptional interpersonal &amp; communication skills are essential - including the ability to work with all levels of organization to drive decisions and influence change. Strong analytical, problem-solving, writing, and presentation skills required along with an ability to multi-task and an in-depth technical knowledge of SAP (preferably TL Harmonie). Notional understanding of French is desirable due to interaction with colleagues at Total headquarters in Paris, France<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> Travel: <\u002Fb>Travel to the Houston office required at least once every two months.<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> International Consideration:<\u002Fb> We regrets that we are unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful> At TotalEnergies American Services we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger.\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    63004BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Cost Control &amp; Reporting \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 10 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Marketing &amp; Services \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p>Give your best to better energy and make the commitment with Total. In addition, this position is responsible for the completion of the many projects through-out the year. These activities are often assigned as high priority with short timelines.<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> Decision Making Authority<\u002Fb> – Direct the workflow for the direct reports to ensure timely and accurate execution of the team responsibilities. Has the authority to make decisions concerning the SAP financial accounting infrastructure and costs allocation methods, and implementation of key accounting changes.<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> Workflow<\u002Fb> – Monthly financial general ledger close for multiple companies, internal financial reporting, and numerous special projects.<\u002Fli>\n     <li><b> Contacts<\u002Fb> - Frequent communication is required within the TEAS Finance Org, SSC Manila, and all shared service customers.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>ACCOUNTABILITIES:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Maintain the accounting infrastructure, costs allocations and integrity of the financial system.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Review, verify, and prepare corporate data in General Accounting according to Group Accounting Rules, IFRS and US GAAP.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitor the Profit Center and cost center structures and the reporting tree of TEPRI (all businesses) and of US holding legal entities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Guide general accounting functions for multiple affiliate companies and systems under shared service agreements.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Steward SAP Accounting processes (power user Accounting).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Adherence to the Company’s Internal Control Framework and procedures, along with required SOX compliance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ensure general accounting employees are supervised in accordance within the Company’s Policies and Procedures, TOTAL’s Code of Conduct and all Health and Safety rules.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b> QUALIFICATIONS:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li> BBA Degree in Accounting, CPA preferred, but not required.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> At least 8 to 10 years Accounting Experience including at least 3 years of supervisory experience<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Experience with SAP “FI\u002FCO” &amp; <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Legal Affairs \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    HOUSTON-LOUISIANA STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p>Under the general supervisor of the Market Compliance Director, the Senior Regulatory Affairs Specialists works across the trading organization as a subject matter expert in regulatory affairs and market compliance. Provides guidance and oversight by researching, planning, developing and implementing compliance controls that help ensure the Company meets all federal, state and other regulatory requirements. Monitors and interprets federal and state regulations, orders and rules and stays informed of current and changing requirements. Coordinates and provides input into regulatory rulemaking proceedings. Provides advice and assistance to internal departments of regulatory requirements. Develops and conducts employee training on the relevant requirements.<\u002Fp>\n    <p><b><br> Main responsibilities:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b> Regulatory Monitoring\u002FAnalysis:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Monitors, researches, analyzes and reports on legislative and regulatory developments that could impact the commercial operations and market compliance control structure of the trading entity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Evaluates market rules; assess their impact on the organization.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Works across the organization to communicate pending or upcoming regulatory proposals and develops positions and input into the regulatory rulemaking process.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b><br> Advocacy\u002FRelationship Management:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Establish and fosters strong working relationships with US market regulators (CFTC\u002FFERC); organized power markets (ISOs\u002FRTOs); market monitors; trading exchanges\u002Fplatforms and industry trade associations responsible for regulatory developments in the US gas, power and renewables markets.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Participates in industry stakeholder meetings, advocacy, regulatory proceedings and market rulemaking on the behalf of the company.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b><br> Market Compliance Controls<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Enhances, develops, implements and monitors internal market compliance controls that help ensure organizational compliance with external market laws, regulations and rules.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Performs reviews, as necessary, related to regulatory\u002Fmarket compliance inquires and potential violations.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b><br> Advice &amp; Assistance<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Provides expert advice on the regulatory and administrative aspects of TGPNA’s entry into new physical &amp; financial power market (including CFTC\u002FFERC regulations and RTOs\u002FISOs rules - tariffs, protocols, operating guides, etc..)<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Provides ad hoc regulatory guidance and proactive counsel to the organization and senior management on market regulatory issues.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b><br> Market Compliance Training<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p><b> <\u002Fb>Develops market compliance training programs to ensure employees are knowledgeable regarding regulatory compliance items.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Trains Front Office (power traders, originators, operators); control functions (Middle Office\u002FBack Office) and other company resources on the design and structure of US Power markets, the related regulatory aspects of trading in the various RTOs\u002FISOs markets and the organization’s internal market compliance control structure.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p>Volatile U.S. energy markets<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Highly competitive environment for new business and growth opportunities due to new market entrants<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Highly skilled and mobile workforce<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p> Fast moving trading environment involving time critical activities and high\u002Frisk rewards from trading operations<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>Are you someone with the following:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><br> Undergraduate degree in business, economics, finance, or similar quantitative discipline; Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger.<br> <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> <b>TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP)<\u002Fb> is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &amp; demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.<br> <br> <b>Our Culture<\u002Fb><b>:<\u002Fb><br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.<\u002Fp>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n <li> Serve as I&amp;E engineer for process hazard analysis (PHA) and Layers of Protection Analysis (LOPA) Meetings to satisfy the ANSI\u002FISA S84 Standard.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> equipment for new and retrofit projects. parties.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide guidance and direction to the management team in all matters of I&amp;E importance.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Assist the Power Distribution Coordinator in technical issues between the site and our electric utility provider in the area of reliability and maintenance activities.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Due to the nature of the job there is a risk of exposure to electrical arc blasts, electrical fires and electrical shock, and will require working in all units of the site is, including hazardous locations. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>This position requires that If you're interested and have the experience needed let's discuss.\n    <br> \n    <br> The Communications Advisor – Internal Communications is responsible for the content development for internal communications, key internal projects from the Group, Brand and Local levels and serving as the primary contact for the TotalEnergies Foundation.\n    <ul>\n     <li> This position develops and implements internal communications read by staff locally in Houston as well as throughout the country.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> This position works with leadership\u002Fdepartment heads to develop and execute communications strategies to align with their business goals. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Position assists Director Communication in leading communications for all Total affiliate-focused efforts in the US. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <b>Responsibilities<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Manages the TotalEnergies intranet site for the U.S., which supports multiple branches and sites, including weekly coordination and approvals with content providers, analysis of site content, and advisement for improvements <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Coordinates with our Global Headquarters Communications and develops news and feature stories about the company<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Prepares and distributes news, announcements, messaging, stories to all and\u002For some employee bases <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Supports the team to craft and distribute messaging during times of crisis for the workforce (e.g. – Hurricane season, winter freezes, floods, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Oversees the Celebrating Our Success program to highlight positive efforts throughout the Refining &amp; Chemical branch in the U.S.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Manages the TotalEnergies Foundation from Paris, including the relationship locally and with HQ as well as the coordination of the Action! platform and events to support the employee volunteerism<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provides in-house design support for posters, brochures, flyers, ads, etc. for Business Units and Departments<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide support for video production – script writing, shooting and editing – as a means to share stories and\u002For messages internally. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Manages, coordinates, and executes large scale projects as directed by executive leadership (Celebrating Our Champions awards program, Intranet, Innovation Days, etc.)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Monitors TotalEnergies presence in industry groups (e.g. - CCD, AEPW) <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     <ul>\n      <li>The nature of this position requires pro-activity, creativity, and a customer-focused mindset. The Communications team is responsible for leading communications efforts and for providing strategic professional guidance to other Total affiliates in the US, particularly with regards to crisis communications and media relations.<\u002Fli>\n      <li> This position requires regular interface and coordination with other Total affiliates, branch and Holdings teams in Europe.<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Journalism, Public Relations or Communications<\u002Fli>\n     <li> On-call availability for Crisis Communication role (24\u002F7 as needed)<\u002Fli>\n     <li> 7+ yrs experience as a reporter, PR\u002FAd agency representative or Public Relations representative<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong written and oral communications skills<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Strong graphic design, page layout and web development skills<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Video production capabilities a plus <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <div>\n     <b><i>TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n     <br> \n     <br> At TotalEnergies American Services we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above give it a try &amp; apply.
