<div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Communication \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    HOUSTON-LOUISIANA STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <div>\n     As our \n     <b>Offshore Wind Communications Specialist <\u002Fb>you will be a key player in strategizing &amp; writing content relevant to TotalEnergies’ growing U.S. offshore wind business. This role is responsible for content development for media, social media and other digital assets supporting our U.S. Renewables affiliate and the offshore wind business.\n     <br> \n     <br> \n     <b>What You'll Do Every Day:<\u002Fb>\n     <ul>\n      <li> Develop and execute integrated external communications strategies that support the Renewables-Offshore Wind business across various platforms and key audiences; <\u002Fli>\n      <li>Support ongoing local media relations efforts and create content for relevant local media markets outlets;<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Develop and manage projects websites and digital media content and engagement strategies<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Conduct communication audits and analysis for market research and material development;<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Manage marketing database and deploy regular communications;<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Provide communication support for event planning and execution as needed;<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Ensure brand consistency across websites, presentation decks, design collateral, and project communications, and manage relationships with vendors and consultants;<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Monitor and analyze media coverage as it pertains to target markets, stakeholders and the Renewables and U.S. offshore wind industry;<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Assist in organizing TotalEnergies’ and TotalEnergies Renewables USA’s (TERUSA) participation at events and conferences as recommended by the business<\u002Fli>\n      <li> Provide support for C-suite public speaking engagements – presentations, talking points, Q&amp;A<\u002Fli>\n     <\u002Ful>\n    <\u002Fdiv>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <b>Dimensions<\u002Fb>\n    <br> The \n    <b>Communications Specialist for Renewables - Offshore Win<\u002Fb>\n    <b>d <\u002Fb>is a part of the TotalEnergies American Services (TEAS) Communications team and reports to the Head of External Communications. Your scope will include:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Developing and implementing strategic and brand appropriate external communications that educate and engage stakeholders in the Renewables-Offshore Wind business.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Developing and implementing social media and external digital asset efforts in coordination with all internal stakeholders and partners as appropriate.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Supporting the Renewables leadership to develop and execute communications strategies to align with business goals.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> \n    <b> Context and environment<\u002Fb>\n    <br> TotalEnergies Renewables USA is building its teams to support the growing Renewables footprint in the U.S. Communications plays a key role in supporting the business. Qualified candidates should thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment and are motivated by establishing the foundations of early-stage projects that require education and engagement at all levels.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <br> \n   <div>\n    <br> \n    <b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb>\n    <br> You'll be well qualified for this role if you have at least 5 years of demonstrated experience as a reporter, PR\u002FAd agency representative or Public Relations\u002FCommunications representative.\n    <br> Ideal candidates for this role will have knowledge of and\u002For experience in climate and clean energy issues, which will be essential in this role. This experience will have given you a working knowledge of external communications as it relates to the rapidly evolving renewables energy space as well as familiarity with messaging strategies for this topic. A Bachelor's Degree from an accredited university\u002Fcollege in Communications\u002FJournalism\u002FMarketing is required.\n    <br> \n    <br> Essential Skills:\n    <ul>\n     <li> Strong writing &amp; interpersonal skills<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Ability to communicate effectively &amp; accurately both orally and in written language especially in advocacy campaigns using earned, digital and paid media<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Proven ability to develop &amp; cultivate media relationships as well as drafting press releases. <\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Proven experience in ideating and delivering digital content for website and social media <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Ability to work across functions and sites<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <ul>\n     <li> Detail oriented; forward thinking &amp; adaptable: ability to deliver on tight deadlines<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <br> This position is based in the Houston corporate office. Occasional Travel to other sites may be required (10%).\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b><i>TotalEnergies regrets that it is unable to sponsor employment Visas or consider individuals on time-limited visa status for this position.<\u002Fi><\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> At TotalEnergies American Services we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n   <br> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Offer ID<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    62806BR\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Metier<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Specialized Communications \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Employment type<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Regular position \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Experience level required<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    Minimum 6 years \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Branch<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    TotalEnergies Global Services \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n   <br> \n   <p><\u002Fp>\n   <div>\n    <p>Every day, our employees around the world live out our ambition to be a world-class player in the energy transition while relying on cutting-edge expertise that spans the entire chain of energies: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 100,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, cleaner, more reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, we put sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of our projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<\u002Fp>\n Attentive Energy is seeking a Public Affairs Intern to help grow brand awareness and build meaningful stakeholder relationships. As an intern at Attentive Energy, you will work closely with the Community Engagement and Communications workstreams to quickly learn our department structure and become an essential member of the team. We are looking for an excellent researcher and writer who is interested in learning at the intersection of community engagement and communications, and passionate about pro-actively addressing climate change with an eagerness to learn about the US offshore wind industry. <div>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    Strategy Economics Business \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    HOUSTON-LOUISIANA STREET(USA) \n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <div>\n    USA\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Job Description<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>Your missions as a Market Analysis America include:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b> Oversee data collection and processing used in the Americas oil balances (supply\u002Fdemand\u002Ftrade):<\u002Fb> Ensure consistency of historical data sources with the research team's Global Oil Balance for crude and product balance. Direct improvement, where and when required, of data collection processes.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Short-term U.S. oil product balances:<\u002Fb> Produce weekly U.S. oil balances for major oil products. This involves forecasting product demand and supply and tracking trade (imports\u002Fexports) by PADD. This will include coordination with the refinery analyst in Geneva relative to the assumptions used in refining (identifying available CDU capacity, operating rates of functional capacity and assumptions on product yields).<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Oversee and manage junior crude oil analyst in Houston:<\u002Fb>In cooperation with the Global Coordinator of crude oil analysis, oversee and manage the work of the junior crude oil analyst in the production of weekly U.S. crude oil balances, monthly forecasting of US, Canada and Mexico crude and condensate supply.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Oversee and manage graduates: <\u002Fb>Oversee and manage the work of graduates in Houston during their 6-month rotation with the market analysis team. This involves coaching and training graduates to produce oil product balances for Latin American and Caribbean countries.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Disseminate market analysis through dedicated Microsoft TEAMs forums and email alerts: <\u002Fb>Disseminate research, market trends, and market news pertinent to the Americas region (including their potential price impacts where relevant) to the trading desks (physical and derivatives) to allow them to react promptly to changes in market conditions.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Maintain \u002F Develop regular qualitative and quantitative reports: <\u002Fb>Including but not limited to the weekly API statistics report, the pre and post-weekly US EIA statistics reports, and the U.S. rack sales charts report for gasoline and diesel.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Data visualization dashboards:<\u002Fb> Develop or direct desk analyst reports to build\u002Fimprove data visualization dashboards (Power B.I.) with the evolving needs of the trading desk and the broader research group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Feed the Americas oil balances to product desk analysts in Geneva<\u002Fb> for aggregation and preparation of the market analysis team's global oil balance for publication in the monthly Global Market Outlook and Performance Committee presentations. Incorporate feedback, and make amendments to demand forecasts when required to finalize the team's global oil balance.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Manage the regional share drive to ensure business continuity and the preservation of corporate knowledge: <\u002Fb>Ensure consistency of the structure of the Houston share drive (organization of folders, sub-folders, and files) with that of the Geneva share drive. Ensure that no research analysis is developed, implemented, or conducted in the personal drives.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><b><br> Relay analysis produced in other locations: <\u002Fb>Ensure local awareness of the analysis produced by desk analysts in other regions.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><b><br> Promote\u002Ffoster a culture of inclusiveness, collaboration, and respect for TotalEnergies' conduct rules.<\u002Fb><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b><br> Purpose <\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b>Prepare U.S. oil product balances, and oversee oil product balances for the Americas.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b> Manage\u002Foversee junior analysts in Houston.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b> Manage\u002Foversee graduates.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b> Respond to ad-hoc informational requests:<\u002Fb> provide relevant commentary and analysis in response to ad-hoc informational requests from the research team and the trading desks.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b> Manage the Houston market analysis share drive<\u002Fb> to ensure consistency with the Geneva share drive architecture to maintain business continuity.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b>Working to tight deadlines:<\u002Fb> Promptly and precisely update the product oil balances to allow rapid dissemination to the trading desks and the research group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Working autonomously:<\u002Fb> the person must be able to work autonomously while at the same time regularly interacting with the Global Coordinators of crude and product analysis and the Director of oil.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Reactivity<\u002Fb>: In a fast-paced and time-sensitive environment, there is an imperative to react quickly and be proactive in responding to informational demands from the trading desks<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Meetings:<\u002Fb> Participate in weekly meetings with the trading desk and the broader research group.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n    <p><b><br> Network development:<\u002Fb> engage in dialogue with data suppliers, consultants, and industry counterparts.<br> <br> <b>Dimensions<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b><br> Regional coverage:<\u002Fb> Americas<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><br> <b>Location:<\u002Fb> Houston<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Reporting line:<\u002Fb> while closely working with the trading desks, the position is hierarchically independent and reports to the Director of oil market analysis based in Geneva and locally to the Head of ATMI in Houston.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Under the guidance of the Director of oil market analysis:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n      <ul>\n       <li><p> Produce short-term oil product balances for the U.S.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Oversee the production of the short-term U.S. crude oil balance by the junior crude oil analyst in Houston.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Supervise the production of product balances for Latin America and the Caribbean by graduates.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Manage and mentor junior analysts and graduate program interns.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Coordinate with the Global Coordinators of crude and product analysis (based in Geneva) to feed the Americas product balances to the desk analysts in Geneva to update the research team's global oil balance database.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Maintain \u002F Develop regular qualitative and quantitative reports<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Maintain \u002F Develop data visualization using PowerBI<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Contribute to the output of the market analysis team through slide presentations, reports, and forum posts.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n       <li><p> Regularly interact with the physical and derivatives trading desks for ad-hoc informational needs.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n      <\u002Ful><\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Candidate profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p><b>You are someone who possess the following experience and competencies:<\u002Fb><\u002Fp>\n    <ul>\n     <li><p><b> Masters's degree in economics\u002Ffinance\u002Fstatistics\u002Feconometrics<\u002Fb> or a related engineering degree.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><br> Over <b>5 years of experience in product and crude oil balance analysis<\u002Fb> with an oil trading company, a consultancy, a Bank or a government agency.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><br> Strong <b>knowledge of the U.S. crude and oil product market<\u002Fb> and <b>U.S. refinery\u002Fpipeline operations.<\u002Fb><\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Strong fluency in English <\u002Fb>(oral and written) is a must; knowledge of French is preferred.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><b><br> Strong drafting and presentational skills<\u002Fb> emphasizing synthesis and succinctness.<\u002Fp><\u002Fli>\n     <li><p><br> Numerical and analytical skills: s<b>trong ability to process large <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>About us \u002F company profile<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <p>At TotalEnergies we know that you're more than what's on your CV. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger. <br> <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.<br> <br> <b>TotalEnergies Trading &amp; Shipping (T&amp;S),<\u002Fb> an international trading company, puts its expertise to use in the global energy markets. With its biomass blending and trading activity, TotalEnergies T&amp;S is an active participant in the development of sustainable biofuels. Our maritime transport expertise also helps to reduce the carbon footprint of sea transportation and we recently announced the time chartering of new vessels equipped with LNG propulsion.<br> <br> <b>Our Culture:<\u002Fb><br> <br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. If this opportunity excites you, but your profile doesn't exactly match the description above...give it a try &amp; apply. Diversity of perspectives &amp; experiences make us stronger. \n    <br> \n    <br> TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets energies on a global scale: oil and biofuels, natural gas and green gases, renewables and electricity. Our 105,000 employees are committed to energy that is ever more affordable, clean, reliable and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, TotalEnergies puts sustainable development in all its dimensions at the heart of its projects and operations to contribute to the well-being of people.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>TotalEnergies Gas and Power (TGP)<\u002Fb> is the trading arm of TotalEnergies in the field of low carbon energies (mainly gas, LNG and power). As such it operates in fast-evolving market dynamics influenced by internal and external factors that require constant adaptation and evolution. Uncertainties specific to the trading environment (volatility of prices, supply &amp; demand mismatches) are coupled with those coming from the broader energy sector (climate change policies, changes in the energy mix, developments of new energy sources, etc). In such context TGP helps to ensure growth and profitability to a key segment of the business in order to reach the objective of Carbon Neutrality by 2050.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>Our Culture:<\u002Fb>\n    <br> \n    <br> We are committed to meet the energy needs of a growing population while fulfilling our ambition to be a major player in the energy transition. The volatility of the energy trading markets requires excellence in risk management and a culture of innovation.\n    <br> \n    <br> Our people flourish in an environment that promotes expertise, entrepreneurship spirit, agility and a purpose-driven culture, generating boundless opportunities to learn, grow and achieve collaborative success while ensuring safety in all our operations.\n    <br> \n    <br> We look for passion, ambition and open-mindedness. While we evolve in a demanding and ever-changing industry, we cultivate a friendly workplace where team spirit and respect guide our daily routine, and where the diversity of our people and their skills create a nourishing experience for all of us.\n   <\u002Fdiv>\n  <\u002Fdiv>\n This includes the review of current major contracts, identification of the cost saving items, quantifying the potential savings and prioritization of the key actions, follow-up of these actions and validation of the actual savings achieved to ensure the auditability of the benefits achieved. <br> \n    <br> As \n    <b>Tax Manager, Planning<\u002Fb> you are responsible for Tax Planning for TotalEnergies in the US (3 US tax groups). You will be a Tax Business Partner for the various branches with a focus on Renewables and Trading. Key functions will be to provide tax advice in support of US and global transactions, tax legislation monitoring \u002F modelling, tax attribute management and support for global initiatives. Additionally, you will provide support for Tax Operations (provision, compliance and audit) during peak times.\n    <br> \n    <br> \n    <b>Responsibilities include:<\u002Fb>\n    <ul>\n     <li> High level decision making regarding tax research, planning and modeling of tax implications with respect to internal reorganizations, acquisitions, and dispositions. decision making regarding research projects and drafting position papers in support of tax positions taken on federal and\u002For state returns, including tax controversy projects. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Managing responses to information and document requests from IRS and state auditors.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Provide tax technical leadership by keeping abreast of changes in the federal (and material state and international) tax laws.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Performing high level analysis of material uncertain tax positions, ensure adequate documentation.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Reviewing cash tax forecast and projections from long-term plans and recommend tax mitigation strategies (ex: BEAT, Section 163(j), etc.).<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Planning and research for issues and transactions that impact the US affiliates and the global effective tax rate. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Formulating and presenting tax advice<i> <\u002Fi>to upper management regarding IRS audit issues and proposed transactions involving US legal structures and investments.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Identifying cost saving opportunities in terms of tax optimization or process improvements.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Participating in staff development and knowledge transfer.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n   <p><b>Context and environment<\u002Fb><\u002Fp> \n   <div>\n    <ul>\n     <li>Must develop a working relationship with the CFOs and accounting managers for assigned affiliates and consult with the affiliates on a regular basis regarding the tax implications for various transactions.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Requires an ability to lead a project to completion – including new investments in the US.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Requires experience with and understanding of deferred tax rules.<\u002Fli>\n     <li> Frequent Interaction with a variety of departments and businesses, sometimes outside of US. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>The individual should have knowledge of tax turnaround. <\u002Fli>\n     <li>Assisting in coordinating with external tax advisors and service providers to deliver needed services <\u002Fli>\n     <li>High level analysis of complex business <li>Leadership regarding international filing requirements and transfer pricing issues impacting the US affiliates.<\u002Fli>\n    <\u002Ful>\n   <\u002Fdiv> \n  <\u002Fdiv>\n  <div>\n
